author: {'steamid': '76561198106629766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6328, 'last_played': 1708856955}
review: I played Majesty 1 when I was a child. Some people dislike Majesty 2, I'm not one of them. I get so much satisfaction watching my heroes get stronger, party up and fight of hordes of enemies alongside dwarven towers. I also like that the game is very hard. I only have played campaigns up until this point. I tried the practice missions but the ones I tried were too hard for my level of skill. I am yet to find another game like Majesty 1 and 2. I hope that current game developers will look at these gaming Gems and that they have inspiration and guts to make games like them so that a genre may develop. the way these games play are so exciting. the partial control over the way my heroes make choices causes so much excitement for me, I get really invested in them just like when I was a child. The missions take a really long time to playthough, though that isn't a problem for me (I don't speed up the time) There are lots of different hero classes and special powers which really causes you to plan ahead and think of the best path forward. Some classes are better than others, rangers are only good for early game I've found. Dwarves and healers are my staple alongside dwarven towers. I like paladins, agrela healers and Blademasters most.  If you find the game extremely hard search "Majesty 2 - The game where you change the difficulty with FPS" by VoloundExpounds on youtube. (He isn't me) If you ever get stuck remember you can abuse the hall of lords by finishing a mission and choosing a level 1 Endgame hero as a lord who will only cost 1000g for your difficult playthrough. for some reason their items including armour and weapons do not contribute to their cost so what ends up happening is that you can have a level 1 beast for 1000g to carry that playthrough if you are able to time the completion of the mission while having a level 1 hero. There is so much content in this game. I have completed the main campaign and I think I have 2 missions left in the first expansion (Grum Gog goblins). Like I said, I have barely touched the practice missions. There is still a lot more for me to enjoy after 100 hours(multiple play-thoughs ) . MULTIPLAYER DOESN'T WORK, I wish there would be a way it could! Please, Someone make Majesty 3!

review: Majesty 2 предоставляет захватывающий опыт в жанре стратегии, где игроки строят и управляют своим королевством, не прямо управляя подданными. Уникальная механика исследования и найма героев создают динамичный игровой процесс. Графика приятно удивляет, а атмосфера фэнтезийного мира полностью погружает. Несмотря на некоторые трудности в управлении, Majesty 2 предлагает увлекательные битвы и стратегические вызовы. Открытия этого игрового мира уже заставили меня увлеченно играть, и я с нетерпением жду продолжения приключений в его глубинах.

review:
童年补票
这游戏的风格与机制是我非常喜欢的类型，玩家无法通过直接操控英雄的行为去达成自己的目的，而是以发布悬赏的方式去影响英雄的行为，进而完成自己的目的。通过[i]税收获得金币 [/i]->[i]消耗金币建造建筑/研究商品/发布悬赏 [/i]->[i]英雄完成悬赏赚取收入[/i]->[i]英雄购买商品回笼金币[/i]这样一套循环来完成目标，让我感觉自己真的在扮演一个领主。
但是难度偏大的战役与智障的AI使得整个游戏的乐趣低了一个档次，加之没有中文，如此冷门真是令人遗憾

review:
Majesty 2 это :
- игра от 1Ass но без русской озвучки в стиме

author: {'steamid': '76561198078955362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4133, 'last_played': 1506846581}
review:
I played the first game as a kid so I had fond memories of the majesty series. But this was a major let down. Found the original majesty disk and tried it out. Was blown away with how much better the game was.

Now that I know I was not imagining it I can say a few reasons why the squeal falls short.

AI was rubbish in the old game. But in a good way characters did whatever they felt like. monsters occasionally wandered into town or appeared and all was good. AI in the new game is much more set. Monsters make a constant bee line to your settlement and your hero are more responsive to flags and don't wonder off as much. This was boring, made the town feel dull. It made it feel more like a RTS without being able to have the control and strategy. Found myself facing wave after wave of enemies, felt more like a tower defence rather then majesty.

Being able to resurrect heroes and having them be recruitable between maps was a really bad idea. It meant you had no attachment to any of your new characters and the power of the old ones meant that that you would be silly to not use them. Made the game a lot less frantic, instead of trying desperately to keep some of the stronger heroes some of the maps with alive or helping other brain dead heroes live long enough to be worth it. You just bring you top tier heroes with there full gear in watched them mulch everything. If heroes died in the old game it was a mad rush to find their grave and hope you could hit them with a resurrection spell in time or a mad rush to recruit heroes to fill the gap created. Now it is just go to grave yard and hit resurrect. Which was boring.

This then brings me to difficulty, majesty 1 had difficultly because you had such restrictions with your heroes, if they died they died. They may or may not be in place or where you needed them to be and you needed to work around that. A troll could be a big problem since you may have just sent all your heroes off to fight a larger boss and the remaining heroes felt a troll was beneath their notice. It made the veteran guard the MVP and made it worth investing in other heroes that would defend the town even if a bit weaker. You had to manage and control your town a lot more and that was where the difficulty came from, you could lose but it was most often your fault. In majesty 2 the enemy is relentless and as mentioned before just charges at your base even if not sensible to do so like bears and wolfs. This made the game more difficult since you have to deal with the waves of enemies while trying to find an opening. This meant to survive you had to bring in your A tier heroes to fight from other maps which is just not as fun and may be why the enemy AI is so aggressive to balance out you OP old heroes.

The final points I wanted to make is that the lore was a lot weaker this time, so may neat units were cut and less interesting alternatives were introduced. conflicting ideologies were not as present this time for temples and units. So you got a lot less interesting choices like choosing what temple chain to cut off or what allied non-human race to use. Some maps even made the choice for you in majesty 1 which made you have to try out different units or learn different strategies. Units also had more dialogue and character along with specific unique missions as part of the campaign. Much less of that in majesty 2. Art style was also better in 1 graphics where 2D but they style was just nicer.

That is my full review. I did not enjoy this game nearly as much as I would have liked but it is OK if you want to give it a go. Just don't go in thinking this is majesty. It is a very different game.

edit: Apparently there is a community patch that fixes up some problems with the AI, and a problem with the FPS rate that made enemy units spawn super fast (thus creating the endless waves). So would recommend you check that out before going into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038146007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 2115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1694909154}
review:
It's a unique RTS in the sense that you don't actually control any of the units, instead you manage/rule the kingdom as "Your Majesty" - You basically build up a fantasy empire in the same way you would playing AOE, Age of Mythology, Rise of Nations, etc. But since you don't control any units (heroes) you need to incentivize them to do anything at all (literally). The whole game play loop mostly works like this:

You offer X of gold to take care of X problem in the kingdom, certain heroes who feel motivated/capable will complete the task and be rewarded. They will use that gold at one of the shops to purchase goods which will then be taxed. I'll collect said taxes to further bolster the kingdom. 

If you offer too much gold you might find low leveled overzealous heroes get themselves killed, or other heroes might not respond to lower bounties after setting a high bounty precedent, etc. 

Lastly this game is hard, and I mean it. The AI will often rush you extremely aggressively depending on the mission, while others have time limits. There was one level in particular called The Rat King where you are rushed almost instantly and it must have taken 15 attempts to figure it out; And considering you can't actually control any NPCs you are kinda left to the mercy of your heroes actually doing what you ask of them. 

All in all it's fun and unique, just pretty darn difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004873536', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2011, 'last_played': 1689521060}
review:
[h1] Изумительное сказочное приключение[/h1]
Очень оригинальная и самобытная игра. Вы не управляете своими войнами по классической схеме, выделяя их в рамочку и отправляя куда вам угодно. Тут каждый ваш боец - это отдельный персонаж со своим собственным характером и прокачкой. Вы лишь можете расставлять на карте свои задания (разведка или бой) и назначать за них награду. И если ваши герои сочтут эту награду для себя оправданной, только тогда они самостоятельно отправятся их выполнять. Ну где ещё такое есть?!)) Вы лишь можете им помогать, строя в своём городе кузницы, рынки, магические базары, где ваша армия сможет, опять таки самостоятельно и на свой вкус и кошелёк, затариваться оружием, бронёй и прочими ништяками=)
[b]Стратежка великолепная, наполненная лёгким юмором и атмосферой приключений в сказочном средневековом мире с великанами, драконами и прочей нежитью.
Если давно мечтали о глотке свежего воздуха в жанре RTS, категорически советую ознакомиться![/b]
[h1] Моя же оценка - однозначно 10 из 10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198213990735', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5646, 'last_played': 1687036383}
review:
Easy to leran hard to solve,
Anfangs habe ich mir schwer getan mit diesem Game, mittlerweile habe ich die erste Kampagne durch.
Die ein oder anderen sind sehr zäh aber gerade das finde ich fesselt einen um so mehr.
Zum teil vergingen Wochen und Monate bis ich mich wieder an eine Mission(oftmals die selbe) herangetraut habe.
Aber mit der richtigen Strategie, Platzierung und Baureihenfolge der Gebäuden, Verwaltung des Goldes und setzen der Fahnen an der richtigen Stelle, ist jede Mission schaffbar.

Ich kann es nur jedem ans Herz legen dieses großartige Konzept eines (meines Wissens nach) noch nie dagewesenes Konzept eines Strategie Spiels.
In diesen Game hat man keine Möglichkeit Helden zu Steuern was, so finde Ich zumindest, die ganze sache wahnsinnig Spaßig und Interessant macht.
Es gibt eine Menge Missionen und man braucht oft mehrere anläufe für eine Mission, heißt Strategien ausdenken und nach dem System trial and erorr die Mission meistern.

Für Jeden der Eigenschaften wie Großer Herrscher, Guter Herrscher, Geduld, Ruhe und Liebe zum folg Besitz kann ich diese Game wärmsten Empfehlen. Man sollte stets offen für neues sein und lernen aus Fehlern zu lernen, was dieses Spiel meines Erachtens nach mehr als vermittelt. Immerhin wird bei diesem Game definitiv die Angst Fehlern zu machen genommen.

Es ist Quasi ein RPG nur aus einer anderen Sicht. 
Anstatt Aufträge anzunehmen verteilt ihr diese und sorgt dafür das eure Helden steht gut gerüstet von dannen ziehen.
Wer viel Fantasie hat, dem sollte es ein leichtes sein zu jeder Fahne seine eigene Geschichte zu erfinden.
Ebenfalls amüsant ist es Helden auf ihren abenteuern zu begleiten und sich die ganzen Ereignisse, als storyline für Anime oder andere Serien in dem Magic Mittelalter Genre, vorzustellen.












SPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILERSPOILER SPOILER SPOILER









Für alle die ein paar tipps haben möchten, was das Spiel um einiges erleichtert:

-Marktplatz und Schmiede in der Regel nahe am Schloss bauen, Steuer Eintreiber haben hierdurch keinen weiten Weg.
-Gasthäuser haben die Fähigkeit alle Helden arten zu heilen, am besten immer einen je Handelsposten
-Verteidigungstürme sind sehr nützliche Gebäude wenn sie zur richtigen Zeit am richtigen Ort stehen, auch hier in der Regel nahe Kanalisation, Angriffs fronten von Monstern und Gegebenenfalls an Handelsposten
-Verzichtet auf das Schnelle Geld der Räuber Gilden, habe es lange Zeit mit versucht jedoch bin ich zum Schluss gekommen das es besser ist diese Fähigkeit nicht einzusetzen.
-Es könne 3 Gilden Gebäuden eines Types Gebaut werden, pro Gilden Gebäude 3 Helden Sprich 3 x 3=9 Helden einer Spezifikation 
-Ihr müsst nicht alle Gilden Gebäuden eines Types entwickeln, damit die anderen Helden der gleichen Klasse die Fähigkeiten bekommen. Die Fähigkeiten können sich die Helden auch aus einem weiterentwickelten Gebäude Holen
-Jede Mission hat eigene Gegner und manche Gegner haben große Schwachstellen, richtet euch bei dem bauen der Gilden nach den Gegnern.
-Mit der Statue des Königs(euer in Stein gemeißeltes Ebenbild)  sind eure Helden motivierter euren Fahnen(Quests) für weniger Lohn zu erledigen
-Fahnen sind die einzige Möglichkeit Helden aktiv zu einem Gewissen punkt zu bewegen, auch hier setz am Anfang einen Mindestbetrag von 100 Gold fest, wenn die Helden aufsteigen möchten sie auch mehr lohn heißt entweder neue Helden anheuern oder den Mindestbetrag der Fahnen etappenweise erhöhen je nach Goldflow.
-Habt keine Angst die Angstfahne zu verwenden hin und wieder ist dies unumgänglich für manche Missionen, auch hier Mindestbetrag setzen, sonst wird es eure Helden kein stück jucken´.
- Exapndiert mit Gebäuden, um ein größeren bereich und eine belebung der Straßen Ardanias zu sichern ist es auch hier sinnvoll Gilden wie Jägerhütte oder Kaserne etc. nahe an Handelsposten zu plazieren, bietet 2 Vorteile: 1.Zusätzlicher Schutz des Handelspostens 2: Eine art patrouillier punkt  Helden werden von Marktplatz und ihrem zu Hause stehts hin und her laufen.


für alle die es bis hier hin geschafft haben zu lesen, vielen dank für eure Zeit,
hoffe der Beitrag gefällt euch und das die Tipps euch weiterhelfen bei dem erbitterten Kampf um den Thron.
 Habt eine gute Zeit, wünsche euch einen schönen Tag,
God bless you
bye bye

review:
It's ok. It has pretty graphics and lots of different heroes.
My favorite feature was the option to add old heroes from previous stages into new stages.
There's a lot of problems: only half of heroes are useful, the other half are either useless or clones to other heroes.
Also, some of the last stages are stupidly difficult. I had to read on a guide on how to beat them: I had to avoid building in certain places in order to not attract the early attention of the boss. This is bad design.
Bottom line: I enjoyed the original more.

review:
An Incredible Game (Actually the whole Series), it's a Fantasy Sim! Majesty 2 let's you hire and provide the necessities for a bunch of heroes to explore and defend the kingdom by killing and destroying your enemies! To succeed, make sure to build Blacksmiths and Marketplaces that sell your Heroes the equipment they need to live and gain glory to gain power and earn money to keep upgrading themselves for stronger enemies!  Places  rewards on enemy Buildings or a Bounty on a nasty enemy that terrorizes your kingdom. Make sure to build up your defense and build trading posts to keep commerce flowing while lining the pockets of your heroes. How should you spend your money? Do you upgrade your palace and get some super-tough Heroes on the battle field, or do you buy powerful spells to cast doom upon your enemies?  You can place bounties on enemies or Enemy Buildings or place exploration, combat, or defense to entice your heroes toward a critical goal or away from a dangerous monster. Make sure to manage your wealth wisely, you never have enough money to do everything you want, so prioritizing is crucial. Build an Inn and upgrade so you can gather the Heroes and Place them into a Party of 4 Adventures, Mix them as you see fit, there are many choices to choose from like Warriors, Rangers, Clerics, Rogues, Elves, Dwarves, Wizards and many more! 

Game is a Blast from the Past! So make sure you don't pass on this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006597307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7156, 'last_played': 1684099495}
review:
Base game is decent (gets a lot of things wrong that Majesty 1 got right). Unique gameplay of Majesty brought forward.

Negative review because the final DLC (Monster Kingdom) is a broken mess. I had to save nearly 100 times in 3 hours to complete the last mission (actually just get through the DLC). I had probably close to 50 crashes in 3 hours: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TPNbcnHZk4Y

Shame on Paradox for leaving it broken like that. Also the 2nd last mission in Monster Kingdom is likewise broken as shit. Also there are loads of bugs and typos. Clear that the final DLC was rushed out the door and given no fixes or patching. Quite disgusting actually. Squandering the potential of a unique concept.

Base game though is still good and the first 2 DLCs work quite well. 

As I said, negative review because of the state of the final DLC. Also I own the collection but steam says I don't own any of the DLCs when I do. They even rushed the process of Steam integration LOL.

review:
Fun game.
Difficulty is based on your computer and fps. You can be a casual and limit fps or u can do it the real way and play without doing it. This way the game is very hard, but it also feels very good finding new ways to do things. It will take many restarts on most maps tho. 
The difficulty is many times rng based and unfair for sure, but it's doable just fine with some patience.

Some of the dlc won't work, but the community tries to patch broken things. The actual developer quit long ago so don't expect any updates.
Worth a buy if u like hard games, and a pass if u don't.

review: Played this back in the day. Now I bought the Steam version and am completing the missions at alarming rate. The game's easy, it's just cheesy. First time you play each mission you don't know what comes. You restart the mission, slightly modify your build order, know where the enemies are going to come, and you win. It's very easy. No bugs, no errors like other people say, DLCs run smooth as butter, and the game's terrific. Has the charm of your classic fantasy world (warriors, wizards, elves n'dwarves, no unnecessary gay crap). Good timesink, since I spent a solid 100 hours outside of Steam completing the game. If you give it a bad review because it's "too hard", hell, look at yourself in the mirror for a dozen of seconds and think of it again. Don't know what to say, wussy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011137625', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1668793772}
review:
Oh god, what an incredible misstep!  Majesty 2 brings back the voice actors from the original Majesty, but forgets the core gameplay.  Instead of a living breathing fantasy kingdom that you influence by shaping its layout, now you have a stripped-down RTS with brain-dead units who must be babysat every step of the way.

No heroes stray very far from your castle, not even rangers, unless you explicitly tell them to with an explore flag.  There are no strategic trade-offs in hero choice, you can have dwarves and elves and agrela and krypta temples at the same time in your kingdom with no negative consequences.  Instead of automatically grouping up with heroes their AI has an affinity for, you now have to manually put together parties in a process that's way more time-consuming and complicated than it needs to be.  Tax collectors glide around like they're on segways, so building placement isn't that important, just plunk a guard tower directly in front of the marketplace and you're golden.

Don't think that the dumbed down gameplay means easier missions.  After the first couple tutorials the missions turn into rigidly scripted puzzles of what heroes to build when and in what order, and straying from this formula means certain defeat.  What's worse, apparently many of these missions were changed extensively by patches so the voice-acted mission briefings are no longer correct (see the dragon mission).

There are some ideas that would have been good ones to add to the original game in a patch.  Healers are now tier-1 units, graveyards are free and save dead heroes for resurrection, monster lairs "level up" over time, so there isn't really a tipping point like in Majesty 1 where your kingdom becomes unassailable.  The music is a zillion times better, and it's gratifying to see your heroes change visibly when they buy new equipment or level up.

It's not as good as Majesty 1, but it IS more fun than any tower defense game I've ever played.  Take that for what it's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030067444', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2233, 'last_played': 1670678420}
review:
Много лет не играл в стратегии, но вот сейчас что-то потянуло. А про Majesty и ее необычное «непрямое управление» слышал много хорошего. Начать сразу со второй части решил, если честно, из-за приятной 3d картинки, ну и того, что ее делали российские разработчики.

Никак не ожидал, что это будет настолько увлекательно. Правила довольно простые, вникаешь быстро, а задачи усложняются постепенно. И как начнешь миссию, как начнешь обустраиваться… и вот уже прошло 3 часа, пора заканчивать, а ты не можешь остановиться. Надо еще одну башню поставить, еще одну гильдию, рейнджеров отправить сюда, медвежью берлогу разрушить и… вот еще минус час.

«Непрямое управление» не сказать, что сильно меняет картину. Думать приходится немного по-другому, но в целом это все равно похоже на классические стратегии.

Сюжетная компания довольно простенькая, юморная.  Мне достаточно и того, что она есть, что это не рандомные карты. Доходишь до финала, смотришь ролик с титрами и радуешься тому, что миссия выполнена. Хорошая, приятная игра. 

В аддоны я пока не играл.

8.5/10

p.s. печально, что русский язык надо ставить отдельно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011517439', 'num_games_owned': 1780, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 7230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7230, 'last_played': 1664245272}
review:
I had played the original Majesty years ago and decided to give it another go on Steam. Since I enjoyed it so much, I wanted to play the sequel as well. This certainly has elements of the original, while in some respects being very different, with both good and bad changes. Ultimately, it is still enjoyable if you like fantasy RTS games. Initially, I was not so sure what to think about this, but the more I've played it, the more it has grown on me. I really enjoyed this and played through the base campaign and all the DLC. Tack on a lengthy set of single missions, and I ended up getting much more play time with this than the original. I was pleasantly surprised with the depth of content.

I wasn't sure I wanted to bother with this game after reading the reviews about how difficult it was because I don't do games that are difficult just to punish you. I did not find that to be much trouble. There were missions I had to look up tips, and there was one or two that made me consider rage quitting and several that I had to try more than once and a different strategy to win. I'd argue the original was worse in that respect.

The caveat to that is I did make two fixes to make the game easier. First, I capped the game at 60 FPS. This is not something I have ever had to do before for any other game, but it is a simple 1 minute fix that anyone can do, which makes the game run at the speed it was intended to, so it is as difficult as it was intended to be, without the difficulty being artificially inflated by running too quickly. Secondly, I installed the balancing patch (after installing the DLC fixes, which should have been unnecessary and is just bad game design, but did work). That is supposed to simplify the game, though I don't know how to quantify to what extent it does that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320881121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5998, 'last_played': 1662193847}
review:
可能是我最喜欢的游戏类型。跟百万僵尸有点像，都是塔防加扫图，区别在于王权2可以养英雄，不同的职业有不同的技能，而且你不能直接操作英雄，而是通过旗帜控制他们的去向，这点简直太爽了，纯纯的手残党的福音。我多希望这游戏能出续作，或者有别的公司出个同样玩法但是游戏质量全方位升级的作品，可惜没有。

说说100小时游戏心得：

一本职业里，牧师可以奶，法师carry位，盗贼性价比高，我基本每局必出。战士和游侠视情况而定，一般二者选其一，因为二本的矮人和精灵分别是战士和游侠的上位替代。如果你准备出精灵，那一本就可以不出游侠，如果你准备出矮人，那一本就可以不出战士。

相比之下，我更推荐用矮人替代战士，因为战士实在太废了，屁用没有还经常死，而且矮人公会是矮人塔的前置条件，在一些需要不断防守的图，矮人塔非常重要。不过，精灵是真的厉害，如果这局游戏防守不怎么吃力，也是可以选择精灵玩法的。

三本职业有很多，有些明显强于其他，比如圣骑士（这可能是我建战士公会的唯一理由）。但是三本职业出什么都没关系了，都玩到三本了，这游戏已经可以随便玩了。

这游戏有钱就是王道，所以前期要尽量避免死英雄。盗贼、游侠这些英雄随便玩，反正他会逃跑，而且复活很便宜，但是法师这种就需要特别关照了。一般来说，如果开局城堡附近有野点，可以直接在野点附近建法师公会，让法师一出生就打野点升级，一般这样下来每个法师都有三四级，基本不会被老鼠之类的小怪单杀了。

这游戏最核心的操作就是插旗子，最基本的要点就是经济循环。插旗子的时候千万不要吝啬，因为花出去的钱最终还是会回流国库的，而且给的钱多，英雄才能迅速换上好装备，才能提高战斗力。注意画面左上角是有技能的，CD满了就可以放，而且没有代价，算是给玩家的一个福利吧。

review:
- klasyczek, fajnie zrealizowany sequel, zabawny z tym samym narratorem, co w oryginale, a w polskim bodajże mówi Fred Flintstone xD
- przyjemna grafika, miasteczko fajnie się buduje, niemniej jednak praktycznie każda misja wygląda tak samo z małymi odchyleniami; niektóre misje rozgrywa się przyjemnie i spokojnie, a inne trzeba restartować po dziesięć razy, bo komputer nas non stop rozwala i jest to męczące, szczególnie, gdy gra się przeciwko ludzkiemu komputerowi, który ma potężnych herosów, których non stop wskrzesza; difficulty curve w tej grze jest straszne
- fajna progresja postaci/lordów z misji na misję, fajnie, że można udoskonalać swoich podopiecznych
- system dawania hajsu bohaterom za eksplorowanie i walkę jest bardzo specyficzny i trzeba się do niego przyzwyczaić, ale ja go lubię; co nie zmienia faktu, że nasza armia w większości przypadków zachowuje się jak dekle kompletne xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198016840818', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5680, 'last_played': 1704118774}
review:
Первые три сюжетки играть можно, последнюю пройти не возможно из за багов, вылетов. Последнюя миссия вообще вылетает каждые пять минут, а то и чаще. Удалось пройти постоянными сейвами. Но это что то невозможное. Если переустановите игру, сохранения слетают, русифицируете игру, сохранения слетают. Сколько раз приходилось начинать заново. Последнюю сюжетку прошел на инглише. Отсутствие в русской игре русского языка без мата не прокомментировать. Чтобы игра меньше вылетала, я удалил драйвера на видеокарту, понизил графику на ноль. В некоторые моменты игра клинила и перезагружаясь все ровно вылетала в одном и том же месте, приходилось начинать сначала, все это о королевстве монстров. Еще один веселый баг, если у вас слишком много фпс в игре, то все постройки строятся раз в пять дольше и когда начинаешь играть, нападают первые монстры и ломают все ваши недостроившиеся постройки, а защититься нечем, потому что казармы еще не построены, соответственно армии нет. Решил проблему снизив фпс для игры через драйвера АМД каталист, которые кстати пришлось снести на последней миссии, чтобы игра меньше вылетала. По негативу все сказал, даже словами не выразить.
 В остальном игра хороша. Ламповая фентезицная атмосфера. Сама игра одна в своем роде. Вы не управляете юнитами, здесь они живут своей жизнью, ходят в кузницы, магазины, исследуют туман войны, ходят на вражину. Ваша задача ставить флаги с заданиями, а герои сами решают, возьмутся за задание или нет. Многое зависит и от везения, так как у героев довольно мало мозгов, маг может в одного побежать на армию тварей и героически убиться, ну и еще много подобных нюансов, поиграете поймете.
В это стимовское недоразумение не стоит играть и даром. Качайте пиратку с русской локализацией.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370471839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1674767932}
review:
Un beau jeu qui vieillit très bien, pour rappel son concept très original et particulier est l'autonomie totale des héros qu'on invoque.
En effet dans ce jeu vous n'allez pas sélectionner vos troupes pour les envoyer au combat, chaque troupe a sa propre IA qui fait des choix influençable par des drapeaux que vous créez contre rémunération (or).

Je vous invite fortement à tenter l'aventure si vous ne connaissez pas cet opus !

Je préviens tout de même que :
- Le niveau de jeu est assez complexe
- Il n'est plus possible de jouer en ligne à moins de passer par un service tiers comme Hamachi
- Pas la peine d'acheter Majesty 2 si vous avez déjà le 1, c'est presque le même jeu

author: {'steamid': '76561198066496454', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1707, 'last_played': 1677506406}
review:
"Majesty 2" is not as good as the first one (sequel is made by different people from different studio) but nevertheless it is decent and sweet indirect control strategy game.
Difficulty in some missions is harsh and game design pushes you to use one predefined tactic to win. It can lead to some restarts if you can't understand fast enough how designer meant this mission to be beaten. But the first game was just the same so you can call this "being faithfull to original".
"Majesty 2" is a lighthearted and funny game, with decent voice acting and nice (but short) soundtrack. Visuals are cute, performance is flawless, works fine on 2022 PC on Win10 without any third-party fixes or manual tweaks. I had a couple of crashes on last levels, though.
If you enjoyed first game, "Dungeon Keeper", "Evil Genius" or any other indirect control strategy games there is not a single reason to miss Majesty 2. It holds up pretty well and overall is an enjoyable experience. But be prepared for tough challenges if you are going to beat this game to the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024772949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1656754118}
review:
As much as I want to like this game, the campaign mode is hot garbage. In order to beat the missions, it seems you have to have the right build order, the right building placement, and a lot of luck. Does that sound like fun? The enemy monsters generally rush your base every mission after the first handful, making it near impossible to get income or to keep the heroes you spent that income on alive for more than a few seconds. Watching my heroes get butchered and my buildings razed, try after try, really hasn't done it for me.
I had a lot of fun in multiplayer with the first Majesty game, but I have a vague memory of the campaign having the same problem. This installment has no internet-based multiplayer as the servers were shut-down a few years back, so there's even less going for this one.
The idea is great. The product here is not at all what it should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005362602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1683562865}
review:
I played this for the first time in 2022, so no nostalgia tinted glasses for me.

I have to say Its really good and original concept. You dont control any units, you just recruit them and give them a kingdom to live in. But if you need something killed ASAP, you can put a bounty on it and heroes will rush to it because money is everything here. 

Beware tho, Its hard as balls. You will get rushed in a matter of minutes in every level and you will restart each stage numerous times before you learn where to build everything and where you should invest your gold to.

Right now I still havent completed the main campaign because there is a boss that runs into your village in first minute of gameplay and single-stomps half of your buildings into ground. GG anyway.

There is an "almost infinite gold" glitch if you want to see at least half of the levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006260457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3332, 'last_played': 1653496263}
review:
Still a great game, maybe slightly inferior to the original, but better graphics and overall smoother. Play the original first, though, then get more here.

This is an indirect control game: heroes have minds of their own, you can place rewards for attacking, defending or scouting targets, but they will do what they will (including run.) For whatever reason this makes it very fun, and it feels like you're a king in a sort of D&D kingdom where  heroes are the truly powerful forces and you can't directly order them around.

There's nothing else like the Majesty series that I know of, and it's very fun. Give it a shot if the above sounds at all interesting to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161723933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 3729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3675, 'last_played': 1694893975}
review: Стратегии непрямого контроля - очень редкий жанр и во времена расцвета RTS, а сейчас тем более. Игра Majesty 2 позволяет ощутить себя королём фентезийного королевства Ардания и обустраивать свой город наподобие базы в RTS, но все юниты при этом игроку неподконтрольны. Они сами исследуют карту, сами решают, с кем сражаться и когда возвращаться с поля боя домой. Всё, что может игрок - это создавать для героев удобства в городе, обозначать приоритетные квесты и иногда влиять на сражения посредством заклинаний. Основная игра включает кампанию о спасении Ардании от демона-узурпатора. Кроме этого, издание Collection включает в себя 3 дополнения. Первое рассказывает о нашествии гоблинов. Второе - о таинственной истории, начавшейся с охоты короля на волколака. И последнее дополнение - добавляет в игру целую играбельную расу монстров. Кстати, хотя серия Majesty на этом заканчивается, но история Ардании продолжается в других играх по этой вселенной - например, в серии стратегий Warlock.

review: Majesty 2 is a superior game. You build dwelling and such and recruit heroes, but you can't control the heroes directly. You can influencing them by placing a bounty on a monster, for example, and you can improve their options by upgrading your markets and such for them to carry more potions and other items that the heroes can purchase. The tax collector is an amusing part of the game; he roams around collecting taxes from businesses and brings them back to your headquarters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 3046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3046, 'last_played': 1642959406}
review:
The Majesty series offers an unique take on the fantasy RTS game style, where you can only control your heroes indirectly by offering gold rewards for attacking/defending/exploring specific targets.

This second title provides several improvements. The "defend" flag is greately appreciated. The four standard heroes guilds now have 3 levels of upgrade with several extra skills for your heroes adding a bit more of depth. They also allow you to carry selected heroes over to next campaings. 

They missed the opportunity to add more defensive structures and for some strange reason restricted the position of Temples. But by far the worst downside is the difficulty. Later maps are borderline impossible and I just learned that there is crippling bug: the FPS is tied to building time. So you may end up taking twice or thrice (or more?) the expected time to build/upgrade your empire, completely breaking the game balance. I tried playing one of the DLCs but the very first map was unbeatable.

No achievements, no Linux port (but worked fine on Proton).

The game would have been great if the devs had fixed this simple bug. I've heard that Majesty 3 is in production - maybe there is hope for the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994861929', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1641753325}
review:
Оригинальная и интересная концепция РТС с не прямым управлением. Понятно, что она же была и в первой части, но играл в нее так давно, что уже ничего не помню. Нанимаешь героев, строишь им здания, где они закупают эквип, назначаешь награды за уничтожение монстров и т.д. Звучит классно, но часто прохождение руинится из-за глупого ИИ (хотя у врагов он такой же тупой) или из-за задранной планки сложности на миссии, когда комп начинает спамить тебя со старта.

Несмотря на все минусы, в игре приятная сказочная атмосфера. И вообще какой-то вайб ПК игр середины нулевых. Пофаниться и поностальгировать на 10-15 часов сойдет. Прошел 13 миссий из 16 в основной кампании плюс один из допов и нисколько не жалею. Я бы даже с удовольствием сыграл в продолжение или переосмысление, но вряд ли что-то подобное когда-нибудь будет.

P.S. Ловил несколько раз неприятный баг. Игра вылетает при сохранении и удаляет предыдущий сейв.

review:
So I was REALLY excited to play this game - I loved Majesty 1 as a kid and was thrilled to find this collection on steam.

I had a real blast with it for quite awhile...until I ran into the save-crash bug.

For whatever reason, there is a chance anytime you save that juuuussst before it finishes saving the game, it will crash. I hate losing progress, and in this game sometimes a few minutes are pretty significant in terms of overcoming some kind of challenge or achieving a milestone (sometimes you only just barely pull it off, and retrying puts that at risk). So its a dealbreaker for me.

Really too bad, its an awesome pack and, for me at least, the gameplay holds up well. The aesthetic is fairly timeless and the systems, while clunky at times, are unique and I haven't found them somewhere else.

Here's hoping Paradox may return to the series and make Majesty 3, because as it stands I can't recommend a collection that has a chance to crash anytime you save your game (causing you, in that very moment of trying to *save* your progress, to actually lose it to the last time you successfully saved).

author: {'steamid': '76561198288168615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5317, 'last_played': 1638839100}
review:
Trotz schöner Spielewelt, Vielfältigkeit und möglicher Tiefe ist das Spiel nur im Anfängerbereich  in 2 bis max. 3  Welten der Kampagne zu spielen. In fortgeschrittenen Welten und grundsätzlich ist kein -Einfach-, -Mittel- oder -Schwer- einzustellen. Permanent fehlt es an finanziellen Mitteln, die nicht gelöst werden können, da einerseits jedes dopppelte Gebäude grundsätzlich bei Erweiterungen von vorne beginnen muss, andererseits werden Gebäude immer wieder erfolgreich vom Gegner zerstört und führt fast immer zum Spielende. 8 eigene Kämpfer schaffen es nicht einen starken Gegner zu eleminieren. Gebietserkundungen werden nicht ausgeführt bei Belohnung von Gold 100, was bei 200 Gold wieder in der Baukasse fehlt. Meine Spielstunden von 88 sind mit irrsinnigen, unzähligen Neubeginnen oder Ladungen von Spielständen verbunden. Ein Weiterkommen im Spiel ist nicht in Sicht. Mir raucht der Kopf! Es gibt auch einige nicht gelöste Fehler im Spiel, Figuren hängen fest und sind handlungsunfähig, Texte sind nicht in allen Collection komplett übersetzt. Externe Lösungen aller Ungereimtheiten habe ich nicht gefunden.
Wie in meinen anderen Rezensionen immer wieder von mir aufgeführt wird, hier massiv Agressivität statt Zufriedenheit gefördert, Das wird den Herstellern nach meinem Empfinden von über 10 Jahren Spieleerfahrung offensichtlich vorgegeben und bestens bekannt sein. Real gespielte z.B. Brettspiele geben immer wieder einen -gesunden- Ausgleich von gewinnen und verlieren. Das gibt es virtuell konstruiert wohl nicht und sollte jedem Beteiligten am Aufbau bis zur Verkaufsreife des Spiels definitiv klar sein. Gleichzeitig wird das Gefühl vermittelt, das -Andere- oder der -Gegner- immer stärker ist. Wenn man teilweise bedenkt ab welchem Alter solche Pc-Spiele freigegeben werden, kann man sich bestens ausmalen, was das mit besonders jungen Menschen macht und in gewissen Bereichen das gesamte zukünftige Leben negativ beeinflussen kann. All das erfährt der zahlende Kunde natürlich vorab nicht und dann im Spiel gibt es kein Ansprechpartner oder Abhilfe. Stellt euch das bitte einmal -real- bei irgendeinem Produkt z.B. Autokauf oder auch nur bei einem verdorbenen Liter Milch vor.  Hier im Spiel gibt es keinen Ansprechpartner, der verpflichtend Abhilfe schafft oder ein zurück. Man erlaubt sich als Hersteller Dinge, die in der wirklichen Welt so nicht lebbar wären. Mit wem und welchen Charakteren haben wir es hier zu tun?
 LIEBE SPIELEMACHER, DAS GEHT WIRKLICH SO WIE BESCHRIEBEN ÜBERHAUPT NICHT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198253958676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3729, 'last_played': 1634989334}
review:
Second installment in unique RTS series with indirect unit control. But I rather 
would recommend play the first one.

- Second half of main campaign is practically unplayable because of bad or broken 
mission design. Many missions are unfair, monsters start attacking your base from 
the very start. This makes levels very strict, having only one way of completing 
them. There is no difficulty settings whatsoever. I recommend to play Monster 
Kingdom DLC as it's more fair and you can actually complete it to the end.

- In comparison with the first Majesty, this game feels slower. Buildings take too 
much time to build. Death animations are too long. Map scrolling is slow.

- A lot of crashes. Randomly during gameplay, while activating map scripts and 
while loading a save game. Fun fact: the moment I killed the final boss, 
game instantly stopped working.

-+ Visual Design. Everything looks generic: UI, heroes, buildings, monsters. First 
Majesty had its own unique style and atmosphere. Also heroes had hand-drawn 
portraits, not a 3D unit portraits. Units are pretty small and often hard to 
distinguish from a distance.

-+ Your only option for multiplayer is TCP-IP. There also was a Gamespy but now 
it's dead since 2013.

+ They've used original voice actor for the advisor for mission briefings and in-
game dialogs. Also they saved a lot of voiceovers from the original game and some 
of new ones are pretty good too.

+ 2 new flags added - Defense (used to protect building, area, or another unit) and 
Fear (stops units from going too early into scripted areas or powerful monsters).

+ Visual progression: As heroes level up and buy equipment, they start to look more 
powerful.

+ Game has a Map Editor.

+ In Monster Kingdom DLC you can play as a monster faction. Also it's more playable 
than main campaign.

My rating: 3/5 tax collectors

author: {'steamid': '76561197970237665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 1606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1633900394}
review:
[b][u]General Thoughts:[/u][/b]
Majesty 2 is billed as a kingdom sim, but is actually an aged RTS. You play essentially the supreme commander of a tiny army of ‘heroes’ whom you control by setting bounties for various tasks. The main unique point of the game is the lack of fine control, instead having to split your resources between upgrading, building, magic and static defences, and the previously mentioned bounties. You can’t be certain, at any point, that the heroes will obtain these upgrades, or attend your flagged ‘quests’, or even deal with the monster that they’re standing RIGHT NEXT TO… but I’m straying into analysis, so onward! 

[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
[list][*]The game can be extremely challenging. Some missions require pinpoint accuracy and lightning reflexes, it pushed me to my absolute limit several times. 
[*]The core mechanic is really interesting. Robbing you of the absolute authority you normally have over units and positioning really forces you to adapt in ways that other RTS games don’t. It can be rage inducing when everything goes wrong at pivotal moments, but that’s the point.
[*]The story is set out in a tongue in cheek fashion, and the dry humour hits quite well.  
[/list]

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
[list][*]The game is relentless. I enjoy a challenge, but this verged on overwhelming on so many missions. The monster spawns are endless and so fast that getting buildings up at the start is a nightmare.
[*]Linked to the above, once you overcome that initial overwhelming hump, the game missions get pretty easy (with a few notable exceptions that just don’t let up). This can be frustrating as it can still take the better part of an hour to finish up and win, even though it’s clear you’re already there.
[*]The AI is so bad, the heroes are just terrible. They don’t even defend their own guild houses sometimes, walking past huge mobs murdering peasants and smashing buildings… It’s annoying at best.
[/list]

[b][u]Suggested improvements:[/u][/b]
 [list][*]Better Hero A.I. regarding self-preservation and supporting the kingdom… They’re HEROES, not MERC’s after all.
[*]A little more control over where peasants can and cannot build. I don’t mind them throwing up their shacks here and there abouts, but I’d like at least a little say in where the sewers are, and the power to build a guildhall over the top of a house… it’s my land. 
[*]Ability to control which places tax collectors visit, and the option to send them out early. I know I could have extorted, but why? I should have administrative control at the least. 
[/list]


[b][u]Overall Recommendation:[/u][/b]
I don’t think this game is for the average RTS player, let alone the average kingdom simmer… it’s ridiculous, and getting through it was a slog. I had to restart most missions from about the 6th or 7th onwards, and the last mission was relentless. (Although there was the odd mission scattered throughout where nothing happened, and I just sort of walked to victory. The pacing is so strange.) For full disclosure, I haven’t played the expansions. Perhaps they’re better laid out and paced… I might one day… but after the final mission in the main campaign? I’m done with this. It was fun, I enjoyed it, GG, but I’m not looking for more bites of this pie, and I do not recommend it… unless you’re a big RTSer and looking for a fight.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198070050815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1627728974}
review:
Сразу уточню, что в оригинальную Majesty 2000 года я играла исключительно в ознакомительных целях, поэтому не берусь судить о том, насколько вторая часть передает дух оригинала, или критиковать тех, кто утверждает, будто «дух утрачен и все пропало».

Для меня у данного издания есть всего один существенный минус. Хочется посетовать на то, что игра создана разработчиками из России, но стим-версия при этом русского языка не имеет, что весьма забавно. В этом же стиме есть несколько инструкций по русификации, однако у меня (лично у меня!) игра отказалась запускаться с не-оригинальными файлами, выдавая ошибки, которые слабо поддавались гуглению. Игра честно куплена в стиме (а еще где-то в закромах лежит лицензионный диск, комбо!), поэтому в конечном счете я с чистой совестью скачала коллекционку со стороны. Скажете, что можно, конечно, и в англоязычную поиграть, какая проблема? Да, но вы русскую озвучку слышали? Она ведь божественна. Ради королевского советника можно было немного и поднапрячься.
Да, чтобы запустить русскую версию на десятке, пришлось пройти семь кругов Ада (большое спасибо, StаrForce), но судьба смилостивилась и подарила мне возможность наслаждаться потрясающей игрой.

В первую очередь мне хочется сказать, что по ощущениям — это самая добрая и самая фэнтезийная игра, в которую мне доводилось играть. Великолепная эпичная музыка, сказочный дизайн зданий, яркая зеленая трава и анимации способностей, даже болтовня персонажей, которой они сопровождают свою повседневную жизнь… Сюжет прост,  незамысловат, не обременен ничем лишним: предыдущий король мечтал о подвиге и впустил в наш мир демона, который захватил в королевстве власть, а нашему величеству (вероятно, законному наследнику), полагается вернуть трон себе. Но не тут-то было! Денег у нас нет, авторитета нет, армии нет, подвиг не совершен, поэтому народ в нас не верит... Да и вообще, с освобождением государства придется повременить, полно забот и без этого — то огр нападает на окраинные деревни, то древний маг терроризирует город, то король Крыс Пятый объявил наши территории своей собственностью, то в очередной конфликт богинь Света и Тьмы нужно вмешаться, потому что кто, если не наше величество, рассудит по справедливости? А потом и вовсе окажется, что претендентов на престол и без нас хватает, нужно показать, кто главный…
Несмотря на то, что во второй половине игры, подводящей нас к финальному сражению, везде сплошь нежить и демоны, нет никакой чернухи и никакого темного фэнтези, сказочность и доброта сохраняются до самого конца. Вообще во всех монологах королевского советника, через которые нам в основном подается сюжет, присутствует легкость и чудесный изящный юмор. О том, что игра от русских разработчиков, я узнала сравнительно недавно, а ощущение чего-то родного и «своего» было на протяжении всего времени, что я играю, а это без малого десяток лет.

Пару слов о графике. Как по мне, даже в 2021 она неплоха, даже если максимально приблизить камеру, чтобы рассмотреть модельки персонажей или детали зданий. Множество мелочей, которые радуют глаз: меж деревьев летают птицы, в траве туда-сюда снуют зайцы, перед постройкой зданий предварительно спиливаются деревья, чтобы расчистить место (часто невольно стараюсь размещать постройки так, чтобы деревья остались целы), да и здания не возникают из пустоты, сначала появляется их каркас, а уже потом прибегают крестьяне с пилами и молотками (если по пути их, конечно, не прикончат). Все баффы и дебаффы героев имеют визуальное проявление, с ростом уровня и новой экипировкой внешний вид героев меняется, у заклинаний анимации — красивые, а звуки — приятные. 
Еще одна маленькая, но приятная деталь: когда город разрастается, крестьянских домиков становится больше, появляется кладбище, канализация, а еще строятся мельницы, правда, от них куда больше головной боли, чем реальной пользы.

Теперь о главном. Хоть мы и король, отдавать приказы своим подданным мы не можем, можем только назначать награду за то или иное задание. Нужно найти, откуда постоянно набегают огры? Ставь флаг разведки и плати, только учти, что разбойница первого уровня за сто золотых и на край карты согласна пойти, а рейнджер пятнадцатого — и два шага от своей гильдии за пятьсот может не сделать. Нашел логово огров и хочешь его разрушить? Ставь флаг атаки и плати, если, конечно, героям это по силам. Ах, погодите, вон у нас свеженанятые воины первого уровня заинтересовались, в ближайшие пару минут придется раскошелиться на новых. На город напали вражеские маги? Ну, ставь на замок флаг защиты, да сумму побольше, чтоб всех героев привлечь к обороне, только не обещаю, что сработает, у них могут найтись дела поважнее. Выпивать в таверне, например. У героев, вообще-то, свой характер есть и свои интересы, не всегда совпадающие с интересами короля. Рейнджер, например, будет игнорировать флаг защиты с огромной суммой, пока не закончит обходить окрестности в «поисках приключений», а послушница может усердно молиться в своей гильдии (или чем они там занимаются?), пока две ее сестры того же уровня из той же гильдии уже вовсю отстреливают нежить или лечат раненых вокруг замка, на котором этот флаг защиты и стоит.
С послушницами вообще бывает непросто. Вроде бы согласилась разрушить склеп и повоевать со скелетами, только по пути она обязательно остановится, чтобы полечить раненого гвардейца, который сражается с крысами под стенами своей охранной башни. А потом полечит воина первого уровня, который убегает от преследующего его огра. А потом вернется к гвардейцу, его снова успели ранить. А еще надо бафнуть всех вокруг. Ой, а склеп уже кто-то другой разрушил, вот незадача. Денег за флаг не получила, новую экипировку покупать не на что.
А еще бывают герои-смертники, у которых, вероятно, не нарандомился инстинкт самосохранения. Такие умирают каждую минуту, сколько их не воскрешай. Проще нанять нового.
Рандом, кстати, в этой игре влияет на многое — например, атака, защита и выносливость героев, натятых в одной гильдии, может иметь огромный разброс, поэтому один условный воин может быть имбой, а другой — вообще ни о чем.
В общем, не все так просто в арданском королевстве…

Помимо кампании (в основной игре — шестнадцать сценариев), есть еще одиночные миссии, тоже с весьма интересным сюжетом и условиями, а также несколько дополнений. Но все равно — мало! Хочется больше. Вообще игра очень затягивает, сложно от нее оторваться, даже когда проходишь уже не в первый раз.

Моя оценка — 10 сказок из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987317718', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 3524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3396, 'last_played': 1627136527}
review:
Сама игра не плохая, есть свои плюсы, но не лучше первой части

Самый главный минус героям похуй на всё и они сами по себе не исследуют карту, не ломают хаты монстрам. Горит родная гильдия? Да и хуй с ней, флага защиты же нет
Прикольные моменты что видно различное снаряжение, способности на героях, можно обьединять в пати героев
Храмы какие-то бесполезные стали, слишком дорого и долго
Модельки героев скучноваты
Нет русского языка, хотя он вроде должен быть
Из 3 длс только королевство монстров можно назвать чем-то новым
Ну и почему минус игре в итоге? Баги, краши, пропадает звук диктора постоянно, сбросился прогресс кампании почему-то, хотя файлы сохранений в папке есть, последняя миссия в Monster Kingdom каждые 4 дня крашит игру. Может переустановка всех VC_redist.x64 поможет, но когда слетает прогресс на финальной миссии последнего длс + она постоянно выкидывает из игры никакого желания играть нет.

В папке majesty2\profiles\номер_вашего_профиля обычно 0 есть файл 0.profile в нем можно любую миссию кампании "открыть", вот у меня оставалась последняя миссия королевства монстров убираем {hidden} из {level
			{name "10_exp03"}
			{last_complete_result -3}
			{hidden}
		} ставим две предыдущии миссии как выполненные и миссию можно выбрать, даже если слетели все сейвы, хотя физически они есть, как сделать чтобы игра снова видела сохранения пока не понял.
По поводу сохранений - игра сбрасывает настройки профиля при переустановке. Чтобы заработали старые сейвы нужно начать новую кампанию найти eё id и вставить этот идентификатор в каждый файл(info.sav {campaing_id "{ваши циферки}"} ) сейвов которые вы хотите восстановить, сохранение у меня загрузилось, но герои-лородв не было, видимо они или в другом файле или также при переустановке стираются

author: {'steamid': '76561197988000877', 'num_games_owned': 1603, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1622933528}
review:
Majesty is a great series and this collection is great from a gaming standpoint. I played hundreds of hours when I was younger and even now think the mechanics are amazing. Technically though, this game is broken far beyond anything I can recommend spending money on.

The problem is that SOME of the background timers are based on frame rate and computer cycle. While everything looks like its working, its secretly broken the balance to a point that it's literally impossible to win. Your builders will always grow at the normal rate, but enemy growth and story events are occurring much faster than they are supposed to. (One mission in particular, I get wiped out before my peasants can finish one building)

There are hardware and software workarounds to get it running properly but its an exercise in tedium to run through the steps every time I want to play... only to always worry that its still broken. 

The game itself it's quite good and completely one of a kind.  Imagine an RTS where your soldiers each have a mind and motivations of their own. You directly build the town but are otherwise limited to placing bounties to attract heroes to do your bidding.

This makes for a unique experience where you're throwing money at a problem and hoping that your high level adventurer will make the trek instead of watching your mages get slaughtered. While your strategy is front and center, the lack of control makes you feel like you're the administrator instead of the general. You can prepare your kingdom for war, but you need to hope your heroes don't screw it up.

The mission variety is pretty great. Some missions are economically focused where you need heroes to defend yourself, while other give you time to build up to defend against one great threat, others have you searching for treasure or defeating a specific opponent. Every mission is a unique puzzle and challenges you in interesting ways.

It's worth repeating "Every mission is a unique -PUZZLE-" because even ignoring the balance issues from broken coding, this game doesn't always leave room for exploring. Particularly, in the levels that start with an enemy attacking you're pretty forced into a specific build order if you want to win. These levels tend to be frustrating until you've survived the initial blows at which point you can try and develop your own strategy. 

I love Majesty but if I'm not willing to put in the efforts to make it work properly, there's no way that I'd expect other people to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103646376', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1622676877}
review:
Старая, добрая Majesty 2 даже спустя 10 лет после релиза смотрится вполне неплохо. Не люблю чистые стратегии в принципе. Но Majesty 2, благодаря своему уникальному, не прямому управлению юнитами, меня время от времени цепляет и я часами в неё залипаю. Нет, здесь нельзя натравить героев напрямую на злобных крыс из ближайшей канализации, что разоряют твоё королевство. Можно поставить флаг и если герои сочтут цену приемлемой, то возможно отправятся в битву. 
Majesty 2 одновременно простая в освоении и управлении, но достаточно хардкона в плане того что времени на раскачку практически никогда нет. Ещё не успевает достроиться первая башня или гильдия героев, как со всех сторон начинают лезть всякие крысы, волки, минотавры, гоблины, оборотни, огры и всякая прочая нечисть. Последние две миссии в основной компании так вообще заставляют стул дымиться. Обязательно пройду их как-нибудь без читов на золото, но потом... когда стул остынет! :))

author: {'steamid': '76561197995280182', 'num_games_owned': 1472, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2263, 'last_played': 1621823641}
review:
Overall it's a fun game, but not as enjoyable as the first.  Heroes seem to lack the autonomy they did in the original, and won't take any action without a reward flag.  Mission objectives in the base game are a bit lacking and generally boil down to do a bit of prep work then fight a creature with a load of health. 
 Additionally, there are seemingly a number of technical issues, particularly with the Monster Kingdom DLC (several missions would cause the game to crash, which I was able to force through either by restarting or saving every few minutes.  This worked until the penultimate mission where it would crash before my heroes could engage the final objective, forcing me to leave the game unfinished.)  If it weren't for the crashes this would be an acceptable sequel, it is fun enough for what it is, but I would steer clear in the meantime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410961372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3449, 'last_played': 1705121667}
review:
I still enjoy it. I can totally recommend you the game even without any of the expansions. The humor is nice (Btw, I love the LOTR references here and there) and it's fun to play  The heroes doing whatever the hell they please it's both amusing and annoying, they are very dumb, but that's part of the challenge! I insist on this point: Majesty 2, without the expansions, is very enjoyable, you can beat the game with reasonable difficulty. No problem here...

Now...
I'm not bad at RTS. I'm quite decent. I had zero problem beating Majesty 2. But the expansions... 
Oh my god, the expansions, in some levels the difficulty sky-rockets, higher than the Everest. 

I still choose to give it a positive review, because of nostalgia (I got a physical copy when I was a kid), and because I think Kingmaker and Monster Kingdom are a nice plus to the series, [strike]even if in MK they added nothing but the same heroes monster version.[/strike]. Kingmaker is a good challenge. Battles of Ardania, however, can be quite unbearable.
Paradox didn't care to fix certain things, which is a pity, for I think this is still a good game overall. Worth a try if you enjoy fantasy and RTS.

review:
[h1]WARNING!!! WARNING!!! WARNING!!![/h1]

This was a great game a few years ago BUT NOW it does not work how it was supposed to and by that I mean IF you have new PC the game's pacing is based on frames and the better your PC the more frames you have so the monsters spawn faster and faster and are stronger quicker than the game intended.

THIS GAME will work great on older PCs but on new PCs the game will spawn 20+ monsters to wipe you out before you even finish building first 4 building and hiring first 4 heroes. Also the game crashed 3 times during 12 hours I did play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005774004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9266, 'last_played': 1596594985}
review:
The game was fun when it came out, and played on systems it was designed for. And really, all the fun parts are because the core ideas designed in majesty 1 were fun, I'm not sure the sequel makers deserve much praise.

Now it's an unsupported game that takes a lot of extra downloads and patching on your part. The difficulty everyone is talking about is from the fact the game's pacing is based on frames. So newer systems alter the game in unintended ways, i.e more enemies, too fast. It can be duct taped and jerry-rigged to a point it's playable - but do you really want to pay money to do a bunch of maintenance on an old game? I mean of course you do, look at the garbage that people buy on steam.

If there were any kind of quality control on digital game platforms, this wouldn't be up because it's only marginally functional thanks to one dude writing a bunch of unofficial patches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288402905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4011, 'last_played': 1692522762}
review:
Paradox should be ashamed to have distributed this pile of glitches and bad decisions.  Frankly, it's insulting that they'd let people spend money on it.
It's almost impossible to beat the last 2 levels because the game will crash CONSTANTLY.  The story text is riddled with spelling and grammatical errors and doesn't even use the same script as the voice actor, which, come on - that could have been fixed with like 2 or 3 hours of work.  That laziness pisses me off almost as much as the crashes.
And finally, I'm ok with the difficulty of the game, but I do think it's lame that they didn't include cheats or difficulty settings for more casual gamers.  They even went as far as to encrypt the save file data when people were going in to give themselves more money for harder missions.  

This is like Paradox's Fallout 76.  Just a big piece of crap and an attitude of "This is what it is, you have no say in it, bugs and crashes are normal, get over it."  I really expected a lot more from a publisher that put out greatness such as Crusader Kings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991262582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1605547850}
review:
Ok, so this is another interesting sequel to an oldie that I missed the first time around when it (2009) and the original (2000) were released. Hmm, looking at those dates, 2009 makes Majesty 2 less old than I thought it was...although both these games make me feel old!

I like the general idea of these games. They are real-time strategies where you decide what and where to build, but don't take direct control of the units you create. You tell the troops what to do by posting contracts and rewards to lure troops to go explore territory, defend a building or other character, or attack. 

The final implementation though and the flow of play are still pretty old school. You start in one corner of the map and build out your base and develop your troops (called heroes in this game) and eventually have to move to the other side and destroy whatever big castle or enemy is there. Along the way there are some contrived scripted events in order to either help you learn the game in stages or to create frustration when you can't do what you want and instead have to do what the developer wants. 

And ultimately, this is the way almost all the missions run. And it gets tiresome pretty quick. When I was a young guy playing RTS games for the first time, it was fun to endure the grind to watch my little digital soldiers finally knock down that last base building. Now, "old school" feels more old than school. If it was a game from 1999, ok, I could accept that. But in 2009 RTS games were mature enough to have been better at knowing what's not fun anymore, and still having to micromanage one section of the map while the AI has its way with the other side while you're distracted...I did plenty of that in Command and Conquer, and at least back then C&C and Warcraft were a little more innovative for their time. 

I don't want to say Majesty 2 is bad, because it is playable and you can have fun with it. However, I do think that in 2020, I have limited time and so I'm going to focus on the best stuff in the backlog. Majesty 2 isn't offering me enough to want to play past the first four of five scenarios.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995524834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1603925373}
review:
I have to say, this game wasn't at all what I expected. Having never played the Majesty series but multiple RTS's before (Warlords 2 and C&C a couple of favourites) I was expecting a standard fantasy RTS. What I got instead was "Quest-Giver Simulator" meets "Blind Hero AI" meets "FFS DO WHAT I TELL YOU Rage Inducer". 

On the positive side, it's certainly a unique approach to the RTS Genre - you basically recruit AI heroes of various classes, but you have no control over your units other than setting 'Flags' of various types which equate roughly to Move Here, Defend This, Attack This. You then use Gold to promote the priority of the Flag and if your heroes care; they'll head out and try fulfil the order and collect the gold. Heroes spend their gold and upgrade themselves as you upgrade buildings and unlock items. A rock-paper-scissors like mechanic means you want to recruit a fair set of different heroes to deal with different threats - Clerics Do well against Undead, Rangers excel at killing beasts etc. The game is...familiar but different and that's it's strongest and weakest aspect.  

The Negative side is it may feel too alien for some - it's like you are being punished to do you usual RTS actions for no real clear reason. You have only a little control of how your base expands, and the early game can be frustrating as you are constantly assaulted over and over by rats, skeletons and various antagonistic npc's who relentlessly assault your base. In addition the AI can be really poor. I've seen multiple heroes stand next to a building as a pack of wolves eats my peasants and not doing a single thing, whilst a lone rambo hero will literally footslog the entire map and run past enemies running towards my base to collect 100gp. It can be very frustrating as you play bystander to actions that in a normal RTS you'd react to. Further more, as your base grows, enemy spawn points appear around your town (Sewers, Graveyards etc) so the stream of endless assaults occurs even closer to your base - so you need to balance where you put your guard towers and overlapping them is critical early on. A poor start on a map tends to mean a restart of the mission and there's a bit of a snowball effect - at some points your just waiting for the gold to entice the heroes enough to complete your objectives as the map is cleared, in others its just quicker to abandon your attempt and try another tactic. In addition the heroes really lack any sense of character - they are pretty generic, and although a 'Lord' System exists where you can promote a high level hero each mission to recruit in later missions, there's no real development of them. Since you can't control them either, you have no real investment in them long term.

So Is it worth a Play? Yes and No. I think I picked this up in a Paradox humble bundle. For what I probably paid for it, yeah it's a fun game if you like the way it works. Otherwise if you just want your typical RTS experience you probably want to avoid it - some aspects are really love/hate and I can see alot of people hating because of how it works. Which is a shame, because the subtle change made to how you play an RTS  has had a very big impact on the game experience and it's unlikely we'll see something similar to it again for some time..

review:
Игра сама по себе просто великолепная, но только не  в стиме. Нет, дело не в локализации. Когда я играл в детстве, игра казалась мне довольно сложной, но я прошёл около 60% всех миссий. Убил дракона, короля Крыса, вроде даже личей. Играя сейчас, я заметил что игра как-будто подтянула свою сложность. Ведь мне, должно было быть легче в её прохождении сейчас, благодаря опыту многих других стратегий, моб. И вот я попадаю на миссию где надо убить Короля Крыса... и понимаю что игра слилась. её невозможно больше пройти. Я жил примерно минуты 3. Я полез смотреть гайд, может я делаю что-то не так... и каково было моё разочарование, когда я понял что они просто просрали баланс игры... В видео, у летсплейщика, охранная башня построилась к 3 игровому ходу. У меня точно такая же строится к 7-8. Гильдя разбойниц и рейнджеров у него строится ко 2 ходу. У меня за это время успевают построить им 200 из 450 хп. Собственно, вот и всё. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Коротко, кто не понял: скорость строительства у nps порезана примерно в 5-6 раз. Вас снесут раньше, чем вы построите хоть одно здание. Дай бог дойдёте вообще до Короля Крыса. Очень жаль, игра ведь была классной

author: {'steamid': '76561198067865475', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1601797411}
review:
So, I've been a fan of the first Majesty game since I was young. This game is an interesting iteration upon it that changes and improves various aspects.

Pros
- Party system: Your heroes no longer wander off alone to die once you get the upgrade
- Graphically improved: the first majesty definitely looks like ass
- Expanded flag system, adding fear and guard flags
- Clerics added to the base hero set of Rogue, Ranger, and Warrior
- More upgrades for your heros
- Lots of the logic and mechanics from the first game stay the course.

Cons
- Markets and trade routes are very limited
- Buildings are less graphically distinct
- Hard building cap
- Fewer buildings
- Building placement is more finicky
- Heroes don't fight, guard or explore on their own, everything is reliant upon flags
- Shitty scenarios

The game is a neat improvement on the original Majesty, one where the differences don't break it. Except the scenarios are just terrible. Instead of the scenario getting more difficult as you go along or a difficult but balanced start and holding the line, 6 of the first 7 scenarios spawn a dozen enemies in the first three minutes making it entirely RNG as to whether one of your peasants makes it to a building and finishes building it, and then it's RNG as to whether the first couple heroes you produce survive. And if you make it through the first few minutes, the rest of the scenario is a breeze with no difficulty. 

There's not much strategy. And it's not fun to restart the first two minutes sixteen times hoping the RNG sides with you this time. There's a couple ideas that improve on the base formula, but you'd be better off playing the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049090884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1599572115}
review:
Get Majesty Gold instead.

Long version:
They have somehow managed to both speed up and slow down the gameplay at the same time. Specifically, enemy attacks and difficulty have been ramped up, whereas your buildings take forever to build, especially with hordes of enemies mobbing your peasants before you can construct a single building. So you have to use the speed-up function when building stuff or it's boring as hell, but you're going to be mobbed and killed anyway once you leave the basic quests, so you're just accelerating your doom. Also, they removed my favorite feature from the original: the ability to continue playing after beating a quest, renaming each and every hero with love aforethought and building the mightiest map-spanning empire ever. 

Really, I just wanted the first game again with better graphics. But you know what? The graphics don't make up for the absurd difficulty increase. You're constantly doomed by factors beyond your control and that just isn't fun for me. So go get the first game and play that; I dug out my old disk and apart from some tolerable UI foibles, it's just as fun as I remember. And it's now available right on Steam.

Sub note: I thought, if I could find some cheats to deal with the difficulty I might still make it through, but there aren't any simple cheats. Bluh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027516589', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7718, 'last_played': 1599356765}
review:
Majesty 2 is called a sim but I disagree.  It is an RTS, a unique and well-made RTS.  The game play is difficult but enjoyable and when you finally get an understanding of your city startup, you'll find it difficult to discover why it was so hard in the first place.  It is still hard after this, but slightly better.  The graphics are good and suite the game well.

On the note of being hard, Paradox released two patches, one for the DLC (which must be downloaded and installed first) and one for the main game.  These patches make the game a bit easier, which is a welcome change.  They are listed below; along with comments on installation.  If you download the patches and are unsure if they worked, you can check by looking at the blacksmith.  It should now have a constant +50 gold output, as opposed to 0 gold output.  This was you can be sure you are set up right.

https://forum.paradoxplaza.com/forum/threads/majesty-2-collector-dlc-fix.983538/
https://forum.paradoxplaza.com/forum/threads/majesty-2-collector-balancing-patch.984292/

One downside to the game.  When the advisor speaks, specifically at the end of a completed mission, he is cut off and you are unable to read his comments.  Some comments are read by him, others are not, and these are the ones you miss.  Also, the game can sometimes take a while to load after choosing the version of the game you want.  Be patient with this.

One tip for the game...the Hall of Lords is a big benefit.  Try and hire your favorite Lords over and over again to increase their level.  Eventually you'll have a level 20 warrior for 2000 g, along with a few other heroes, and they'll be the driving force in your winning strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051547379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1704940986}
review:
Hell yeah this game is fun!

It's pretty much like an RPG simultator somehow: you don't command your units directly, you only set buildings to be built and bounties on your enemies and the AI will take care of the rest. The only resource you have to get is gold and precious time. Time is always of the essence in this game.

There's different types of heroes you can train: warriors (tank), rangers (dps/scout), mages (damage), clerics (healers), rogues (dps) and so on. You got to plan ahead the combination of heroes that you think will be the most valuable.

Your heroes will level up and gain gold every enemy they kill, with the money they get, they buy equipment you research at the market you've built. The heroes will wander off looking for adventure on their own, some might stay close to the palace to clear out enemy units that's trying to destroy your buildings. However they won't destroy creatures nests or explore the map by themselves, if you want an especific nest destroyed or an especific region explored, you're gonna have to set bounties with the gold you have, the more gold the more heroes will be attracted to it.

Unfortunately the game lacks in content and settings options. You don't have a sandbox/skirmish random map generator, there's a campaign that gets harder the later you are at the story, and scenarios that are brutal in difficulty and there's no way to customize the game in any way to make it easier or harder.
