author: {'steamid': '76561198013547276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24299, 'last_played': 1699151381}
review: I wish I could get this game on my Mac, as I no longer have a pc.  It's been a while since I've played this and thought I should add to the positive reviews.  I really enjoyed this game and beat it several times.  I do agree with people that say it becomes very difficult rather suddenly, but it can be overcome.  It's a strategy game and it does well in forcing you to create a different strategy to win each level.  The pacing can be quite challenging, but it's such a unique game that I would love to see more of.  The satirical humor is nice.  The graphics are lovely.  The details are wonderful and there are so many.  The characters have beautiful outfits that visually change with upgrades.  I especially love the gowns on the female temple heroes.  The building designs and their upgrades are so well designed.  You truly feel like you are getting upgrades visually as well as with stat increases.  The one thing I would have changed is that I wish I could choose different colors for my empire.  I do get tired of the blue.  Simple things like that can make another playthrough feel more fresh.  I don't think this game deserves much of the hate it gets.  More games should be this good.  I would love to see a new installment of this playable for mac, but I'm pretty sure that's never going to happen.  If you crave a complex and visually satisfying strategy gameplay, this is worth your time.  Is it perfect? No.. nothing is, but I got many hours of satisfying entertainment from this.  I would argue that this is one of the most visually satisfying games I've ever played.  One funny thing of note, is that with the expansions, you can see a degradation in the quality of the writing and voiceovers.  They lost some key person/people along the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045738147', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1535328355}
review:
I love the concept however the game is brutal.  There are no difficulty settings.  You would think killing the monster dens would lighten your load but monsters still swarm in from the edge of the map and there is no stopping that.  Ressurecting a single hero will empty your treasury once they start getting close to lv10.  Spells cost gold and are expensive and hardly worth using.


Also a single peasent can repair a watchtower faster than your heros can damage it.  A single enemy peasent has warded off more attacks than the enemies own soldiers in my last game which actually made me rage quit.  Only a swarm can deal with a single unupgraded watchtower that is being repaired by a peasent.  And no, the heros will not focus on the peasents unless you flag them with lots of gold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056559458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1599768446}
review:
I was a huge fan of the first one (and still play it every once in a while) and I decided to check this out.

Pros:

-you can move the camera
-the game makes a graveyard when a hero dies
-ALL heros can be resurrected
-it puts the status of all heros in the top right corner
-the missions have a good variety
-money seems to accumulate faster than the first game
-buildings are built faster
-looks pretty good
-there are fear and defend reward flags
-you can add lots of money to reward flags quickly
-one of the starting guilds is a healing guild
-heros level up quicker because there are more enemies attacking the town

Mixed:

-you have to use reward flags for almost everything. Heros will barely expore or attack without them.
-the wizards still die very easily

cons:

-no freestyle quests
-pretty much have to do the quests in order
-if you are stuck on a misson, the cutscenes get old quick
-trading posts can only be put in certain spots
-you can only build a couple temples per mission and only in certain spots

overall I'm enjoying playing this game. I would wait for it to go on sale to buy.

Also, apparently there is an issue with the DLC not working but I haven't run into any problems yet.

review: This is an old game with old mechanics. Play this if you like games where you don't directly control your units, but instead issue explore, defend or destroy orders. The units are independent and decide on their own when to attack, flee, go rest or buy new equipment. The bad side of this is that some units might ignore enemies that are attacking your base. These situations need to be solved by building your base elsewhere and only defending your main castle. Also, in the early missions you will get swarmed by low level monsters so it's important to build 4 towers around your base in every mission. Other games similar to this would be Space Rangers 1&2 (because you can donate money to influence world events) or Driftland: Magic Revival.

review:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for this game yet! This is without a doubt a legendary, unique game. Think of it as WoW as an RTS.

Where to begin? This game is a hero management sim. You build guilds and recruit lowly heroes from them then, through cash incentives, royal spells and upgrades, they survive, level up and, ultimately, win you missions!

In depth:

The currecny of the game is cash, it is gathered via taxes collected by your 'taaax collecteer" (you'll get used to that cry, among many others) Tax paying guilds include your whole collection of guilds, homes, shops, etc. The amount of tax you take in increases along with the amount of money these buildings raise, and you can control how much money they raise in various ways.

The market, for instance, starts out offering nothing by way of equipment for your heroes, but with some affordable investments you can research the ability to sell them health potions, mana potions, protective charms and the like. Ditto the blacksmith, which can upgrade the armour and weapons of your hero types. With each upgrades comes a hero, spending his hard earned cash to buy it, in turn sending higher tax revenue to your castle.

How do the heroes make cash, you ask? Well the most direct way is by slaying monsters and destroying their dens - and collecting chests arrayed around them. The other way is by their meeting objectives - aka 'quests' - which you set out for them.

Case in point. A minotaur is ravaging the outskirts of your town. Your guards, distracted by hordes of rats coming from the sewers, are unable to come to the assistance of the citizens who you would like to be working on some new structure. What do you do? Right click on the minotaur to put a red 'kill' bounty on it, then add gold in ammounts of +100 or +500. Now sit back and watch the tally of interested heroes tick up. They'll flood in - healers healing, warriors being meatheads, rogues stabbing, rangers bow'ing, wizards wtfpwning, elite heroes being elite - and won't relent until the mob is dead, and their purses weighty.

Missions have varied objectives, but all of them reward the ballsy expansion of guilds and reach, investment in your heroes and your shops. The game is wonderfully balanced and fun. At the end of each mission you can recruit your highest level hero to stay with you throughout the rest of your campaigns - in future you'll be able to recruit them at a special 'keep' guild for huge funds. Being able to call on a level 10, 20, 30 hunter when all your other heroes are level 1-5 can be a huge relief - if you have the funds.

The game is humorous, with a lovely brand of light hearted high fantasy. I say it is like an RTS of WoW and the similarities are not just in setting up quests gradually leveling heroes. The graphics are remeniscent, even the models of the heroes and the enemies seem to take inspiration from Blizzard's mmo, and the sum total of this is that there aren't many faults to find with this game, on a visual level.

It also has a steady but challenging difficulty curve, the first missions of the campaign are challenging but beatable, later missions become genuine challenges to your mastery of the mechanics.

I don't know what else to say. This game is unique (apart from the original which was great in its own, oldschool way) and anyone who likes RTSs should play it. I'll have to surrender my usual increments of 5 rating system and go gamespot on this one: 9.7/10.

review:
操作がシンプルなため「RTSの忙しさ」が苦手な人でも十分楽しめます。

プレイヤーは国王となり、自らユニットを動かすことができません。
王国のユニット達はそれぞれ目的を持って自律的に動きます。パトロールしたり、探索したり、他者を癒したり、戦闘で得たお金で武具を買ったり。

プレイヤーは建物を建設し、ユニットにサービスを提供（武具やエンチャント）することで国力を強化し、懸賞金（討伐や防衛）や魔法によって間接的に問題に対処することになります。

英語力は、ストーリーを理解する上ではそれなりに必要ですが
ゲームを楽しむ上では問題はないでしょう。

地味なゲームですが、今までプレイしたRTSでは過去最高レベルの名作の一つです。
1シナリオ１時間程度で遊べる。
そして飽きずに繰り返しプレイできるものになっています。

＜その他＞
○ ＭＯＤは殆ど出ていませんが、「COLD SUNRISE」というキャンペーンＭＯＤがあります。難易度は高いですが、クオリティが非常に高くお勧めです。

○ アップデートサーバーに繋がらない問題があります（2018/6現在） このため、レベル4武具や追加スキル（レンジャーの範囲攻撃など）が手に入る最新のパッチを適用できません。開発者が「Majesty 2 Collector DLC Fix」というパッチを公開しているので、こちらを使用することで最新化にできます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141884863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1662110431}
review:
(Got game from Humble Bundle)
Ok, so let me start with the good...

Game has good humour, cheerful arts, and helpful guide to progress along. You might get jebaited into thinking "Hohoho, what an easy introductory game into this genre." Let me tell you something... it's not.

After the tutorial phrase and about 5 or so easy maps in Campaign mode, prepare to cry a river, or two. Prepare to get your ass handed to you when you get swamped by enemies before you finish building a SINGLE building. Then resentfully press that restart button to pray to the RPG Lord that THIS time around, at least ONE building get spared. The Campaign mode will come to a stop unless you beat these near impossible boss stages - 

Edit: 2 HARD maps are The Rat King & The Royal Feat (dragon Rafnir). 
My advice: Wizard guide and wizard towers for the rats + build Lord tower south to avoid the dragon until late game and you're good to go. Took a lot of trial and errors for me to complete. 


Sometimes, this game is like Dark Souls for RTS games / gamers :)

review:
Difficulté totalement stupide : on se fait enchainer par des vagues successives d'ennemis avant même d'avoir pu construire un seul batiment (et donc avant même d'avoir pu construire la moindre unité), vagues d'ennemis qui continuent sans cesse en tuant les paysans sensés construire.

Je veux bien jouer mais faudrait laisser le joueur construire des unités avant d'envoyer des vagues d'ennemis ? J'ai l'impression de jouer au multi de Age of Empire 1, mais avec l'adversaire qui cheat en prime.

Bref, dommage que la difficulté soit un total n'importe quoi puisque le jeu serait surement très intéressant autrement, du moins c'est le sentiment que j'avais après avoir fait le tutoriel et la mission qui suivait qui étaient les seules à être tout à fait jouables en terme de difficulté.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982342447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1524418864}
review:
I was trying to remember why I didn't enjoy while playing Majesty 1 for a really long time since demo I got on a CD back in the days.
To start: You need a fix to make it work now with DLC, cause servers no longer work (gamespy I guess).
There is a bug with VSYNC, that you need to turnon/turnoff every game restart otherwise building times are slower making it impossible to play.
For once the AI is really passive. Rangers don't really scout the map on their own unless you tell em to, Warriors don't occasionally attack lairs (they did in M1). For some reason with lots of cash on their hands, heroes still don't purchase best armor, fight with no potions and so on. Heroes ignore not only when buildings are attacked, but when their own guilds are attacked (sometimes they defend it, sometimes they go elsewhere). Wizards are a pain with constant dying until they get to 6-8 lvl at least even when ALL upgrades and items are available they will still find a way to die stupidly. And again, AI is PASSIVE. Until you pull up a 500-1000 gold flag they won't do anything.
Features. Basically it's barebones M1 clone with worse design, with less buildings and less well everything.
1. No more Gnomes that helped building stuff, you're stuck with slow human builders. Not even Dwarfs help with buildings at least.
2. Elves don't bring cash and casinos to kingdom, they are just overpriced archers. That's it.
3. No more Battlegrounds to help train heroes.
4. Temples are now stick with specific spots on map that you have to fight for and defend later. The fact that temples are only available at Castle LVL3 is crazy. And god forbid you lose any high level temple hero, 18k revive awaits.
5. Revive system makes it OK to throw trash at you in numbers or enemies that one shot heroes with top stats and over 18 lvls. There is no work around, sometimes you will throw like 20-30 heroes at a quest boss to see 10 of them to die.
6. Trading posts are only placed at specific spots where they are hard to defend which makes em useless.
7. They love timed missions where they also spawn lots of different staff at map borders every minute. Yeah, cause this is exactly what makes it hard.
8. Skills are too important for heroes, otherwise heroes are weak.

Difficulty is almost always about fat spongy boss or specific enemy, or a bunch of powerful enemies spawned by triggers while you try to fight em off, that is boring and lazy design.
Maps feel the same, I don't remember any actual change of scenery and it's always flat with rare hills.
Add-ons are even worse than the basic game with even more systematic spawns to fck you over. There is no knowledge here, only memorising stuff. You play mission, you get weird spawn out of nowhere, lose suddenly and try over and over.

This is a sad game, with all the potential it might had, the development team was lacking skills or will, to make it a proper game.  Just.. Ignore it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014031332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1507508815}
review:
Игра скучная и однообразная. Под интересным заголовком "Стратегия с непрямым контролем" скрывается обычная примитивная RTS.

Абсолютно все миссии идут по такому сценарию:

1) Выдерживаешь "первую волну"
2) Отстраиваешься, копишь ресурсы
3) Нанимаешь огромное количество героев.
4) Ставишь баунти с огромной наградой на нужное место
5) Смотришь, как твоя армия всех разносит.

Поначалу игра веселит, но из-за дичайшего однообразия рано или поздно надоест так, что больше никогда не захочется запускать. Да, тут приятная графика, озвучка, юмор. Но сюжета в полном смысле слова нет. Т.е. не останется ни единого фактора, удерживающего вас в игре.

Про главную фишку игры (непрямое управление) хочется сказать отдельно: спустя какое-то время приходит осознание, что это та же RTS, только с очень кривым и раздражающим управлением юнитами. Герои реально тупые, вам могут месить критически важные здания, а им по барабану. В то же время они любят лезть далеко и умирать от сильных врагов. Здания и апргрейды, очевидно, делаются напрямую, как и везде.

Поиграть в Majesty можно разве что "для галочки", как в единственного представителя жанра. Может, в будущем стратегии с непрямым управлением возродятся. Но для этого у юнитов должен быть мощный ИИ, а тупоголовые болванчики из Majesty приносят лишь раздражение.

P.S: 349 руб - это высокая цена для такой игры. Если уж очень хотите попробовать "непрямое управление", дождитесь распродажи, я взял Majesty 2 со всеми DLC за 100 с чем-то руб

author: {'steamid': '76561198099824271', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1525728045}
review:
The base concept of Majesty 2 is a brilliant game. Sadly it isn't executed well.

The main things that led me to give up after 6 missions were the game-breaking bugs. At least I think they're bugs. But I did try to patch and they were still there so...

Basically, at the start of several missions it seems to trigger the boss encounter immediately and your settlement is then overrun with creatures and high-level, non-defeatable attacks. This would be fine if the game gave you time to at least start building up defences beforehand, but it doesn't. There is a very thin line of luck to walk that can see you through the opening of levels, but when it happened for the third time I just couldn't be bothered to grapple.

Add to this the fact that the very interesting concept (attract heroes to your town, send them out on missions, form parties and send them back out, let them gather loot etc) isn't very developed. Beyond recruiting the heroes there isn't much to do - I would have loved to see gameplay where you have to meet heroes needs - make sure there is enough ale in the tavern, enough farms to provide food, enough crystals to create mana etc...) But it doesn't happen.

Which is sad, because underneath the missing elements and flaws, this is a characterful game with what could be very addictive gameplay and a rewarding victory on each map. It is also genuinely funny, as the Sean Connery-esque narrator does some fine work guiding you through. But it was just too broken and not finished enough for me to bother investing more time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196793377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 87, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1710443829}
review:
Эта игра, одна из первых стратегий моего детства. Миновало десять лет, как я не играл в Majesty 2. И вот я рискнул и купил её, имея винду 8.1 ) И риск того стоил. Моментально 22 часа отыграно. Пройдена первая кампания. 

 Я ОЧЕНЬ ЖДУ, когда кто-нибудь решится на продолжение этой легенды. Ведь по факту, это уникальная игра. Персонажи как настоящие игроки в мморпг - должны фармить и выполнять задания, чтобы получить денег и купить снаряжение, зелья и улучшения. Если все это развить и пропиарить... Будет похайповее Stellaris`a. Но пока-что есть только приложение для смартфонов... 

 Хоть разрабы это и не читают, но если вдруг... Займитесь проектом. В конце концов есть кикстартер.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999208736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1532884612}
review:
Imagine an RTS/sim-type thing where you watch over noobs in an MMO.
It's exactly that.

There's no strategy to it. You build a market for the noobs to buy gear from, but there's no sense of how much gold it gives you or how often. 
The game amounts to spamming noobs and resurrecting them when/if they die. You can get through every map if you put it on 5x speed and do exactly that. And there really is no incentive to do otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110435334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1695818879}
review:
Нахлынула ностальгия, решил купить и перепройти, начал с оригинальной кампании. 
Миссия с крысиным королём не помню чтоб была такой адовой, грёбаный Сталинград. Ни одна гильдия кроме маговской не успевает достроиться, т.к. крысы сгрызают рабов, а король призывает всё больше и больше. Под чародейской башней и на одном маге отсидел месяц, пока насобирал на гильду ренжей. 50й день: маги и ренжы 10+ уровня, ставим рынок и торг. пост, начинаем играть. Пока развивался крысиный король потерял 20к хп из 25к на своих вылазках, т.е. сыр уже даже не особо был  нужен, чтоб его убить. Выиграл за 120+ дней, уровень сложности миссии - advanced.
Миссия с драконом aka Рафнир, там где на тебя с трёх сторон со старта летят змейки, а они уже не такие дохлые как крысы, ренжы их уже не так лихо разбирают, т.к. сами с 4х тычек мрут, а бежать домой начинают только после 3й, т.е. мрут. Я помнил свою старую страту с постановкой башен в ключевых точках и выносом гнёзд до такого как из них попрут змеи. Только нихрена это тут не работает, т.к. первая волна змей прилетает до того как достраиваются башни и Рафнир ещё до кучи, который делает 3 дыхания. Кое-как смог воткнуть зал героев и взял ренжа 16 лвл, которого всячески мотивировал и им же разбирал гнёзда, пока замок в окружении башен жил.
Следующие 2 миссии - изи катка.

10 мёртвых сборщиков налогов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198099379126', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 35733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14571, 'last_played': 1700003560}
review:
Excelente jogo, extremamente divertido.

Ao contrário de jogos clássicos como Age of Empires e Warcraft que você controla unidade por unidade de combate (o famoso RTS, estratégia em tempo real) e de jogos da franquia Total War que você controla não unidades, mas verdadeiros batalhões e destacamentos, Majesty 2 te coloca em uma situação que você treina os heróis e cria recompensas para que eles "de livre e espontânea vontade" ataquem os monstros, explorem as áreas ou defendam a base. É uma dinâmica diferente e bem divertida.

Ao mesmo tempo você precisa criar mercados para vender poções, ferreiros para vender armaduras e armas novas, guildas para formar grupos de ataque, o que cria uma economia que garante recursos para o tesouro do reino, o que permite treinar mais heróis ou disponibilizar novas mercadorias para os seus heróis.

É um jogo, na minha opinião, extremamente viciante. Com uma dinâmica inovadora. Vale muito a pena adquirí-lo.

Campaign and pre-made single missions have an impossibly steep difficulty curve. author: {'steamid': '76561198042815980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1517704213}
review:
Let's start with the strengths, graphics and sound are neat. ... Okay, I'm done. Forgot anything? ... No.

On paper this sounds like an interesting interpretation of an RTS-RPG Combo.
So you build heroes and units and they do the dirty work. You just offer quests to them like destroying enemy spawn points. The more you pay the more units will participate. You focus on the economy and build your town.

This initially sounds weird. Units making their own choices? Didn't we feel annoyed in numerous RTS titles when we had our army lined up for the big push and suddenly single units would advance on their own because we forgot to turn off some "auto-attack" command? So how does it feel when you got a whole army of individualists? Sounds like chaos and that is pretty much what you will see in Majesty 2. You cannot give orders, you rather "bribe" them to maybe attack or defend somewhere. All that is very time consuming and unprecise. When will they react and how many will come? If they are too few they get slaughtered, if they are too many your base defense is down. It sounds like a step ahead, like AI is doing the micro management for you, instead you need to anticipate the AI's stupidity and end up wishing you had old school direct control over your units in many situations. 

Well, so the player's heroes are not smarter than the enemy. Consequently the player could spam units and make up for the lack of quality AI.

And that is where the game looses you, when you experience, that enemies spawn much faster than you get money to replace your killed units. And this is early in the campaign in missions that are labelled "novice" difficulty. There is no way of adapting the challenge to your flat learning curve.
The campaign feels like the last 2 minutes of a lost game of "Age of Empires" when you just watch enemy units slaughtering your peasants as the flames go higher.
Aiming for challenging missions, Paradox went far beyond that point to the world of impossible mission design? Did anyone really test the campaign before the game went public? I cannot imagine they did. 
If the player is tasked with defending objects 30 seconds away on the map it doesn't make sense to put enemies right next to it that will destroy the object before even the first unit of the player is on the scene. There may be some sort of workaround tactics but that is besides the point. Many players enjoy the challenge of outsmarting the level design by avoiding certain triggers - when they [u]replay[/u] the game. It is not the player's job to anticipate impossible tasks on your first playthrough and if you are a mortal human and lack this biblical gift of foresight you will be pretty annoyed.

All this, mind you, will happen while your base is constantly attacked from all sides by spawning enemies. Does this sound familiar to anyone? Right, that is Tower Defense. Okay, challenge accepted. But then towers get increasingly expensive so again you cannot build as many as you would need to keep up with the swarms of enemies and get overrun.

Flaws other reviewers mentioned come on top of that. It's right, servers are down. Online gaming is off. Yet this is irrelevant. If a great game does not offer online game, players will miss that. I don't even want to play this game with friends and even if i wanted I would have a hard time convincing them to play this game, even if they had already bought it which again I could not recommend in the first place.

To wrap it up:
Majesty 2 is a huge contribution to level design. If someone wanted to know how NOT to design missions, playing this game for 2 hours is mandatory.
If on the other hand you are an ordinary gamer without the gift of prevision and looking for a decent RTS game, don't bloat your library with Majesty 2. If you get it in a bundle like the recent Humble Bundle, together with another game that seems worth the money on its own, it won't hurt you to give Majesty 2 a try. There's always a chance you might feel different about it. Even for the price of an alcohol-free beer, I'd say have a drink instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048751346', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1519776659}
review:
→ My cousin and I recently bought the Paradox Interactive bundle from Humble Bundle, primarily so that we could try Majesty 2's multiplayer. We saw that the online servers wouldn't still be up for online multiplayer (given the death of GameSpy), but figured we could still play LAN multiplayer. We can host a LAN game, and connect to the same game, but when we try and start the selected game mode, the game gets about 2 seconds in before we both get a "Desynchronization Detected" error, after which the game closes out of the Multiplayer map immediately and goes back to the lobby screen. I know this is an old game, and I don't expect the developers to continue their support for something from 2009, but it was still a massive disappointment, since I don't really find the solo campaign maps to be a ton of fun (enemies swarm into your starting build location almost instantly, and you don't actually control any of your units - you just bribe them to defend or attack things with gold, and you may or may not persuade them to actually do what you want them to).
 → We both also had to jump through some hoops via a Steam Community write-up for a multi-step workaround solution to get the game to even recognize the DLC bundled with the "Majesty 2 Collection" title on Steam, so it's a pretty big thumbs-down there as well (Don't bundle DLC with a game and try to sell it through a digital marketplace if it's not going to work upon startup...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016101502', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1640471655}
review:
[h1]Hodnocení: 6/10[/h1]

[b]Velmi podivné vyvážení obtížnosti[/b]
V případě Majesty 2 byla opravdu obtížná volba, jestli hru doporučit. Hra je prvních několik hodin skrze prvních několik levelů opravdu zábava. Naneštěstí brzy zjistíte, že ač se postupně odemykají další funkce, hrdinové, budovy atd. je gameplay každého levelu vcelku totožný a po 10 hodinách hraní začne hra být dost stereotypní. Druhý zásadní problém je nevyvážená obtížnost hry, kdy některé levely musíte na spustit třeba 10x než se chytíte protože na vás během 2 minut začne útočit velký drak a spousta malých dráčků a likvidují vám základnu dříve, než pořádně postavíte základní budovy. Tohle mě na celé hře vytáčelo asi nejvíce. Následně když se při neustálém nátlaku vaši hrdinové dostatečně vylevlují tak hra se naopak začně stávát čím dál snažší a výzvu většinou představuje jen souboj z bosem daného levelu. Balanc obtížnosti je zde zkrátka špatný. Poslední negativum, které zmíním je hudba. Jestli hratelnost je stereotypní po 5 hodinách hraní, hudba mi lezla na nervy možná už po hodině a raději jsem si vypnul a pustil si hudbu na Youtube.

[b]Skvělá myšlenka a příjemná grafika[/b]
Hru jsem nakonec doporučil, tak abych jen nekritizoval tak pochválit musím grafiku a humorný příběh to se mi oboje zamlouvalo. Hra vyniká především svým specifickým stylem hraní kdy stavíte, zkoumáte, najímáte hrdiny ale ty hrdiny nemůžete ovládat. Jen je motivujete tím, že vypisujete odměny na činosti, které chcete udělat. S touto mechanikou jsem byl relativně spokojený, i když je pravda, že někdy mají svou hlavu a nechápete proč daný úkol nechce nikdo splnit když jste tam narvali takových peněz. Nebo se zabití silného mostra vydá jeden osamělý mág, který umře po dvou ranách. 

[b]Shrnutí[/b]
Abych to neprotahoval, hru mohu doporučit pokud chcete zkusit trochu jiný styl real-time strategie se silnými RPG prvky, ale neslibujte si od toho stovky hodin zábavy, ačkoli pokud by jste chtěli dohrát celou hru i s datadisky tak by to bylo možná i na 100 hodin, ale pokud vydržíte dohrát alespoň základní kampaň než vás to přestane bavit tak máte můj obdiv.

review: This is a brilliant idea destroyed by dreadful implementation. There are so many design choices in this game that are just startlingly bad. You can't rotate buildings. You can't manually control your heroes, but the flag system used to assign them jobs is not precise enough to be used effectively. The gameplay is extremely fast - from the first minute of the map, you'll get swarmed by hordes of enemies. And they never stop coming. There is no building up your town, no exploring the land, no training a party of heroes and setting up a quest - it's just chaos from the moment game starts to the moment you destroy the last damn skeleton crypt. Not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054694151', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1517058101}
review:
Am Anfang ist es super einfach
und nach ein paar Missionen merkt man schon, dass man nicht so bauen kann, wie man es beigebracht bekommen hat.
Man wird sofort überrannt und dann stirbt der erste Held und schon ist der Friedhof da, der unaufhörlich Skelette spawnt.
Die Kanalisation ist auch schnell da, welche dich mit Ratten zuscheißt.
Am Anfang geht das noch, weil man einfach neu startet und mit dem Wissen, wo die ersten Monster kommen Türme baut.
Dann kommt die Mission mit dem Magier, der andauernd die Häuser und Bauern tötet... Magiergilde kostet 1000 Gold und aufrüsten auch ziemlich viel. Soweit so gut, ein paar Türme stehen an den besten Stellen und man wartet, dass Steuern eintrudeln. Dann kommen Tauren und töten die Bauern, weil die sich einfach weit außerhalb der Stadt un des Schutzes der Türme Häuser bauen... und dann kommt der Werwolf, gegen den man ÜBERHAUPT nichts entgegenzusetzen hat... jeder Held ist one hit und das Vieh hat 3000 Leben....
SAUBER gemacht... voll geil... macht echt Spaß...

author: {'steamid': '76561198081224114', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1540684435}
review:
This is what it must feel like to be a guildmaster on an MMO game.
This game so far is amazing and a lot of fun.

Unfortunately, the game is only fun during the first levels, even tho you unlock much cooler stuff (such as raid parties) later on; the main issue with this game is that you are not the attacker, you are the defender.

In many adventures, the adventurers raid dungeons and enemies; in this game is the other way around. Because of this, high level enemis will rush into your city before you are prepared, puting you at a constant stalemate and making the game into a tower defense.
This deeply sadens me because of the sheer potential of this game; overall, this is totaly worth to buy for the concept and experiencie (not so much for the execution).

author: {'steamid': '76561198160389622', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1664733865}
review:
My only answer to the game was quit. I have played this mulitple times and each time I just end up quiting because of how stupid the devs built the game. 

1st- Enemies always spawm your base in under the first 3 minutes. and unless your lucky you will have some kind of building up to beat them back if lucky or to try and fight/run over and over until either they die or you win.

in the end my opinion of this game is that it needs a huge amount of love before I would give it my recommendation. 

and before anyone says but your hours aren't high, i have this game on my laptop that i play on when traveling and its never hooked to the internet but ounce a month for updates

author: {'steamid': '76561198054780409', 'num_games_owned': 1814, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1443797469}
review:
Стратегия с непрямым контролем. Majesty 2 достойный представитель жанра занесенного в красную книгу.

Что мы можем:
-Строим здания
-Производим апгрейды
-Назначаем цену за флаг.

Какой еще к черту флаг спросите вы? Тот, которым мы хоть как-то можем манипулировать своими героями. Хотите исследовать карту поставьте флаг, хотите кого-то уничтожить поставьте флаг и да, не забудьте назначить цену за это действия. Просто так герои навряд ли займутся этим вашим назначением, нужен стимул.

Герои, которые обитают в вашем королевстве делятся на классы: маг, вор, воин, рейнджер, послушница. У каждого свои особенности и навыки, каждый занимается тем, чем ему больше нравится, то-то исследуют, кто-то охотится.  Но, что бы у вас появился герой того или иного класса, для начала нужно построить специальную гильдию.

Своих героев можно объединять в пати и тогда они повсюду будут ходит и качаться вместе. Толпа — это сила! В своих странствия герои зарабатывают не только опыт, но и деньги, которые тратят на покупку лучшего снаряжения, если же конечно у вас в городе вы возвели здания и исследовали нужные апгрейды. Если во время боя ваш герой получил смертельное ранение, не печальтесь его всегда можно возродить в храме. Правда, чем выше уровень героя, тем больше за это потребуют золотых.

Исследуем пустоши выносим агрессивную живность и логова из которых эта самая живность лезет (пока не уничтожить логово твари не перестанут появляется). А когда прокачались посильней на нейтралах идем вешать люлей, сопернику и карать его героев, за то, что выбрали не правильную сторону

Отличная игра, редчайшего жанра. Как жаль, что поддержка проекта так быстро прекратилась, а еще бы хотелось не просто карт-сценариев, а полноценного сендбокса. Ну еще в игре есть кампания, это само собой подразумевающее… )

author: {'steamid': '76561198417323766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4477, 'last_played': 1704860149}
review:
Well, it's not bad, being fairly fun and all, it is buggy as all hell. The last few missions of the last DLC are considered unplayable. I wish I knew that before I bought this. I googled how to fix the crashing only to learn that it has been a known problem for years. Even before then the game will frequently crash due to bugs, several quests are buggy as heck, I've beaten several quests due to glitches registering a win as soon as I started, sometimes resurrected units resurrect without HP and die again, or worse, remain dead but fill your guilds regardless.

To make things much worse, if you buy it you have to crack it. Yep, you will have to crack a game you bought. The servers have been down over a year, but you have to connect to the servers to let the game know you bought it, so after buying the game you are called a thief, and if you want to play the game you just bought, you have to edit the Config Files. Some users posted guides how to do so, but it takes forever if your not fairly tech savvy, and it is ridiculous how you have to crack a game you own.  So if you buy this game have fun being thanked with accusations of piracy.

Edit: No longer need to crack. However, the latest patched ruined the in game timer. Have fun being swarmed by end game monsters before your first building is up!

In all seriousness, while fun, the numerous bugs just kill it. The fact the game's DRM can not connect to it's non-existent servers means you have to crack it. Hell, one poster on Gamefaqs or some such claimed the crashing is caused by the DRM thinking your playing a pirated copy, so I wonder why Steam is even allowed to sell this game as is...

author: {'steamid': '76561197986922743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 4146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3676, 'last_played': 1616561050}
review:
First off, don't let the screenshots fool you, this game supports 16:9 (1080p). Here's a quick 15 minute overview/review video I made:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=407012810

Majesty 2 is one of my favorite go-to games, and has been since 2010 or so when I first picked it up on DVD (non-Steam version). There's something about the RPG elements, where your heroes level up, buy new gear, and get new abilities, that really appeals to me. As almost anyone even remotely familiar with the Majesty series can tell you, this is not a game where you select a group of units and give them orders, like a standard RTS. Instead, you set flags on things to tell them to attack, defend, explore, or stay away. How much reward you put on those flags roughly determines how many units will join in the effort.

I won't go into too much detail about the actual mechanics here. That stuff is easy to find out. Instead, I'll discuss why I love this game, and why I think you should pick it up.

First off, pretty much every expansion besides the base game, is insanely difficult. There are balance issues or I'm just a really terrible player, probably both. I don't know how it would be humanly possible to complete some of the missions on the later expansions without either a ridiculous amount of patience and luck, or maybe a little cheating. There's just one cheat I recommend: You can edit an .ini file in the game directory to change the effects (and costs) of some of your spells. The "Extortion" spell normally collects a % of the taxes you have coming, and by default it has a 0 cost, since you lose a little of your tax income by using it. You can actually set the cost at a negative value, and it will give you a bit of bonus gold. I only use this after trying and failing at a map 2-3 times. I know, I'm a terrible person, but it's my game and I'll play it how I want to!

It's important to keep in mind that cheating is not always necessary. Often times (at least in the base game), there's a trick to beating a map. Usually it involves a certain combination of units, like building a certain type of unit first, other times it involves avoiding or exploring a specific area as soon as possible. Sometimes there's a "bonus" objective that, if you know where it is, you can get to it early and earn a huge chunk of gold from it.

With a bit of breathing room, this game becomes a soothing sandbox to play in. That's why I love it so much. I can just zone out for a few minutes (or hours), placing buildings, forming parties at the inn, placing towers, and just stomping around. There are spawners placed around the map, like bear dens or hell gates, that will continuously send creatures out to attack you. Sometimes, just for fun, I like to leave them in place and let my heroes level up for a while before destroying them.

After a game you can select one of your heroes to save for later. Then when you place a "Hall of Lords", you can hire that hero and he/she will continue to level up. You can rename them too. Awesome.

Each map takes around 45 minutes or so to complete, depending on how well you set up your economy and building placement. There are also special maps you can play, outside the main campaign, but you don't get to take your saved heroes into those.

It is a shame the developers have basically abandoned this game. There's the long-standing "DLC missing" issue that has plagued the game for a few years now, and the fix for it requires some mucking around in the file system, running sketchy batch files and the like. Bah. That and the insane difficulty (which, after 50+ hours sunk into this game, I do believe might require cheating at times) are the main reasons people have for giving this game a thumbs down. For me, and my tastes, I don't mind too much.

Back in late 2011, a cat I'd had for 14 years (since moving out from home) was getting in bad health. He would snooze on my lap for hours while I played Majesty 2. I was job hunting at the time, but being unemployed gave me more time to spend with my little friend during his last weeks. I will always remember that time with a mix of sadness and warmth. Because that cat, he was such a good friend, and there I was spending time with him playing Majesty 2. I guess this game kind of holds a sentimental place in my heart, and maybe that's why I can so easily overlook its flaws. Now I'm crying again.

Whatever the reason, I love this game. If someone asked me "What's the lowest rated game that you just love anyhow?" it would probably have to be this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960575030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1509244955}
review:
This is the worst strategy game I have ever played. The first 5 missions are ridiculously easy. The 6th mission is impossible to complete without cheating. The player has about 20 seconds before the base is attacked by a dozen dragons. It happens so quickly that it's impossible to build a warrior's guild before the dragons come. There is only enough time to build a rogue or ranger guild, but those characters suck and can't kill dragons. The dragons continue to attack the base in packs of a dozen or more, and there's no way to construct new buildings while that is happening. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bTSOHYInWqI 
In the above video, one can tell the player is cheating because his buildings are constructed several times faster than normal, and the dragons do several times less damage than normal. Look at the health bars on the buildings. They barely move. 

Majesty 1 didn't have a set order of missions. If one mission seemed impossible, one could skip it and do the other missions.Majesty 2 is not like that. I get 5 missions that are incredibly boring because they are too easy, and then 1 impossibly difficult mission that prevents me from seeing the rest of the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198020536124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2606, 'last_played': 1668449906}
review:
Отличную идею загубило криворукое исполнение.
Игра могла бы стать раем для казуалов. Все, что вы можете делать - строить здания, нанимать героев определенных классов и назначать награды для этих героев за те или иные действия. Все остальное делают сами герои - сами решают, какой "квест" им брать, куда и когда им идти, что им покупать. Казалось бы - идеальная основа для простенькой игры, в которую можно позалипать пару часиков и отдохнуть после сложного дня? Делать почти ничего не нужно, построил здания/героев по своему вкусу и сиди, квестики выдавай наслаждаясь ярким фентези-миром.
И тут начинаются проблемы, потому что именно в этот момент разработчики показывают тебе хуй.
Все мы знаем, что почти во всех стратегиях ИИ феерически тупой и с вами может потягаться только за счет различных бонусов в виде доп. войск и ресурсов.
Эта игра не стала исключением. Только вот беда- на этот раз ИИ играет ЗА НАС. Герои представляют из себя полных дибилов, которые ведут себя совершенно рандомно. Мне не хватит и 3 обзоров, чтобы описать все нелепые ситуации, в которые мои герои попадали из за собственной тупости. А что "квесты"? Да ничего. Герои на них реагируют по настроению. Захотят - возьмут. Не захотят - будут тупить до последнего, хотя ты слил всю казну на награду за вооон то логово рядышком с замком. 
И ладно бы только это, ну мало толковых Искуственных Идиотов в стратегиях, ок.
Но нет. Разработчики второй раз показывают вам хуй, делая большую часть карт просто зубодробительными. С первых же секунд на вас попрет вся фауна этого чудного мира, не давая закончить постройку даже первых зданий. Мирное развитие? Отдых? Ага, напрягите булки и запаситесь успокоительным. Зачастую вам придется специально проигрывать, перед этим исследуя карту, запоминая расположения всех "насестов" чудовисч, а так же запоминая на какой день и откуда придет очередной сверхсильный монстр, который, если вы не будете готовы, спокойно снесет вам несколько зданий и убьет героев по-одному. Так что приготовьтесь сначала соснуть на одной карте 2-3 раза, а уже потом, вкусив чугуна и хрена, навалять всем вражинам. Это раздражает, поскольку иногда складывается впечатление, что все так и задумывалось - сначала проиграй, а потом играй. 
В общем скрипя зубами прошел оригинальную кампанию, получив удовлетворение лишь от пары миссий. В первых двух дополнениях даже пытаться не стал - там вообще какое-то безумие с первых миссий происходит. А вот последние дополнение, где мы играем уже за "темных" прошел с удовольствием. Оно легче (не считая пары миссий) и почти такое, каким должна была быть игра.
Не поймите меня неправильно. Я люблю стартегии и всегда стараюсь проходить их на максимальной сложности, но конкретно в данной игре это не работает, потому что от вас почти ничего не зависит, вы имеете лишь весьма условный контроль над ситуацией. А ведь игра могла бы быть чем-то красивым и простеньким, чем-то, что можно было бы перепроходить целиком (а не возвращаться лишь к любимым миссиям) просто расслабляясь и наслаждаясь атмосферой и хорошим юмором.

Плюсы игры:
- Простой, но местами весьма оригинально поданный сюжет
- Хороший юмор (необходимо знание английского)
- Красочный мир и приятная даже по современным меркам графика
- Оригинальная (хоть и всратая) идея

Минусы игры:
- Однообразность (ну пройдешь ты кампанию, даже весьма скудные сценарии пройдешь, а дальше что?) С разнообразием войск тоже слабовато
- Сложность
- Отсутствие локализации (не проблема, если можете в инглиш)
- Вылеты (игра не побоиться крашнуться под конец миссии, на которую вы убили уже почти час)
- Стим 
Зачем покупать игру, если в ней нет ни ачивок, ни карточек, а разработчики давно забили? Можно ведь просто ЙО-ХО-ХО ТРУ-ЛЯ-ЛЯ :^)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085118066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1508256380}
review:
非常有趣的一款游戏，当年算明快出色的画面。类即时战略，但里面的英雄并不直接受你控制，他们有自主意识一般鲜活的存在着，有着自己的脾气，会为了赏金战斗，会逃跑，会休息，会购物等，很棒的创意。
我看到评论有说难的战役很难，前几分钟就会崩盘，个人认为还是技巧问题，市场要先造，而且要离主城城门近，方便纳税员挣钱并升级回血药，盗贼与游侠先起，盗贼营有收取赃物赚钱的技能。法师不推荐（价贵血低速度慢），一般宁愿多造个牧师楼，乐趣主要也是在前期的布局，并不是很看重运气的游戏。
后期有些战役要远征打怪，先在酒馆组好队，英雄等级装备要起来，存好钱使用回血护甲复活等技能或为墓地复活英雄留钱。
真希望能有majesty3的开发，虽然这个游戏很依赖英雄的AI，但这不正是乐趣所在嘛，掌控大局，细节交给他们自己，哈哈哈

author: {'steamid': '76561198328840662', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2598, 'last_played': 1697883511}
review:
老游戏了。作为小众游戏，游戏的可玩性是值得推荐的。不过玩法、套路比较单一，英雄AI的底下，和近乎变态的管卡设置赶走了一大部分玩家。本人作为从1玩到2的7、8年老玩家，也会开局各种崩盘，玩这个游戏开Randomize模式运气往往比技术重要，不开反而索然无味。

PS:最后告诉新手朋友们一些万金油套路。如果某一关前期小怪过多总是扛不住第一波进攻（这种情况会很多），你可以尝试起手法师营地，关键位置造魔法塔防御（不一定非要买200，当个吸引火力也可，压力大就买），然后法师满编，记住一定优先给法师2本冰冻+火球，如果有还没刷出怪的巢穴，悬赏让法师速度5级足以SOLO大部分中小型怪。（如果选择优先造法师千万不要研究蓝药，法师的购买优先级是蓝药其次红药，装备优先法杖其次护甲，如果你研究了蓝药就会看到身上5个蓝药没红药的法师到处招摇过市然后扑街）。然后根据情况补盗贼或牧师。
这种关卡本人一般不会造巡林者，如果没有定期的狼人或者熊人来犯战士我也不会造，直接矮人。不过各个关卡套路都会有些许不同，比如亡灵怪多，起手2本牧师。野兽怪多，巡林者神器。战士在没有太多经济或特殊情况直接3本研究大盾的情况下，少造（或者造在牧师营地旁边）。
如果你是喜欢挑战的玩家，可以试试全高等英雄的玩法。游戏后期高等英雄祭坛比较多的关卡，如果在基地附近有一个的话就可以试试。在初期，初级英雄营地造出来不招募，经济全部用来升级基地和市场，前期除了塔基本没什么防御手段，可以养圣骑士，或者女巫、驯兽师、大祭司等等，玩起来也非常有意思。
如果开局经济很多，一定要2级大本和2级市场起手。记住药剂塔很关键，法师营地造出来可以就研究个附魔不造法师，药剂塔比冲三本和三级市场优先级要高，经济永远是硬道理。
英雄技能研究除非特殊关卡比装备研究优先级要高。比如盗贼的3本技能，战士的3本技能都是只要造了一定尽快研究。
打人型生物精灵神器，比如有一关三攻三防的法师精灵战士牧师和海尔利亚神射手定期来犯，这一关优先冲经济，速度三级大本+三级市场+药剂塔，造3根矮人塔，2根基地北侧，1跟基地东北侧。（并且2功2防也必须要有了。）矮人营地先不造矮人，塔造完速度起精灵。全力保精灵，精灵的等级一起来，基本守住家就很轻松了。一个防御旗帜就可解决，不用再单旗帜神射手了。
勋爵可以选择一些属性不错的巡林者或者盗贼（因为便宜，旗帜敏感度强，很实用），有时开局起手勋爵能起到意想不到的效果。
大祭祀营地最优先，因为有复活技能。其次圣骑士或驯兽师或女巫，技能实用且IMBA。
补充：
不要用盗贼行会的盗掠技能！你的经济会非常差，基本相当于正常运营的一半。如果你不知道总是喜欢点这个技能也一样通了关，那么恭喜你，正常运营玩的话你会很轻松的。
怪物巢穴除了一些必须清理的或者用来前期给英雄升级，可以多留一些，不然到了中期英雄们没有可以用来升级的工具，有的要求硬质量的BOSS就很容易死很多人还打不过。
有的BOSS的攻击特效在攻击建筑物的时候是没有的，比如第一个比较有难度的BOSS巨人领主，先用矮人塔吸引他的仇恨，给塔加血就好，不会有群体击飞的高额伤害，打着就很轻松了。这个套路基本所有BOSS都能用，也可用驯兽师的行会技能召唤熊替代矮人塔，加个圣骑的盾非常肉。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023173016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 9190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2028, 'playtime_at_review': 5724, 'last_played': 1710814717}
review:
Makesty 2 is a fantasy simulation game where you dont control a hero. No no, you get to control a KINGDOM! Lead your kingdom and your heroes to take back your land!

PROS

~Its an enjoyable mix-up, where you arent the "hero" but the mayor

~Lots of classes that branches out to advanced classes

~the bigger your town gets, the more enemies that attack, which is a neat feature

~Its very comical, from names to descriptions

~There are some logical feuds with heroes, like dwarves and elves, and palidans and necromancers

~The longer you let a monster building stay, the more advanced it gets, which is a neat feature

CONS

~Its obviously dated, with older graphics and AI

~Sometimes, the heroes are EXTREMELY greedy, to the point of which you'll ask 500 to search a spot a few feet away from an already discovered spot

~Rogues are quite useless, they die often, and dont do much other than steal a few gold coins from enemy graves and poison things.

~The final boss is SUPER BS! If you dont do everything PERFECT, you'll end up being destroyed and have to restart, Ive done about 20 retries with the final boss, with each being about 30 minutes to an hour, until out of sheer luck, he glitched out

~The content is broken, since the company that made this game, GameSpy, went out of business, and cannot access online.

OVERALL

7.5/10

Ita dated, but its fun. I wouldnt get the collection since the DLC is, well, unavailable unless you do some wacky hard thing that dosent garuntee that it will work, but if you want the game thats less money, go here

http://store.steampowered.com/app/25980/Majesty_2/

otherwise, if you wanna try your luck and coding skills, buy this game and attempt. If you fail but like the game, you can always refund it and buy the original Majesty 2

review:
Majesty 2 review 

Majesty 2 เป็นเกมวางแผน ปกครองเมืองที่โดน ฝูงปีศาจมืดฟ้ามัวดินมาถล่ม หมุ่บ้านเรา   เราต้องจัดหาฮีโร่ และ อุปกรค์ ต่างขายให้ ฮีโร่ทั้งหลาย

เนื้อเรื่อง : มันไม่ค่อยมีอะไรมากนอกจาก ป้องกันเมือง เสาะหาที่มาของมอนสเตอร์ และเวทมนต์ดำที่มาก่อกวนเมืองของ แค่นั้นละ

ระบบเกม : ฟังดูเหมือนเกมวางแผนทั่วไปแต่ เกมนี้นำเสนอในแบบเราเป็นจ้าวเมืองแทนที่ จะออกไปตะลุยเควส แบบเกม RPG  เราจะต้องคอยสร้างตลาด ไว้ขายของ ไอเท็ม และ อาวุธอัพเกรด ให้เหล่าฮีโร่  และอัดเกรด ป้อมปราการไว้ป้องกันตัวเมือง  คุณต้องวางแผนก่อนว่าอะไรควรสร้างในต้นเกม และ รีบสร้างให้ไวที่สุด เพราะพวกมอนสเตอร์ ดูเวลาไม่เป็น มันคิดจะบุกเมือง แX่ง ก็รีบบุกเลยแบบไม่มีปี่มีขลุ่ย  ต้องรีบอัพเลเวลฮีโร่ ที่เข้ามาในเมืองคุณให้ไวที่สุด เพื่อไปตีรังของพวก เพื่อที่จะลดปัญหาการที่มอนสเตอร์เข้ามารังควารเมืองของคุณ  

กราฟฟิคเกม : ถือว่าทำออกมาเรียบๆ ไม่มีอะไรหวือหว่า เพราะมันลงไปทาง เกมการเล่นของเกมซะหมด

สรุป : ถ้าชอบแนววางแผน แบบรวดเร็วฉับไว และ ชอบคว่มท้าทายแนะนำ Majesty 2 เลย  และยังมาพร้อมกับภาคเสริมต่างให้คุณได้เล่นอีกมากมายเลย  7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038611529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4043, 'last_played': 1501420205}
review:
This game is my worst habit, so I'm writing this review to pass the time during re-install.

The good:
- Micromanaging sucks, and Majesty is ostensibly free of it. You get to sit back, mind the economy, and watch your heros level up and become stupidly powerful.
- The campaign is entirely tongue-in-cheek, and those who bother to listen to the pre-mission audio are in for a treat.
- Strategies are quite varied. Every building/research decision you make is done at the expense of another option, and I've had more than one mission that seemed impossible at first but was doable once I modified my starting strategy.

The bad:
- This game is incredibly unforgiving -- and you can't change difficulty! The combination of lack of control and punishing AI makes this an infuriating experience.

Sure, it's engaging. Addictive, even. But it's not fun to spend an hour per campaign mission fighting game mechanics rather than a fair enemy.


Oh wait, the download finished. Screw this review business; I'm headed in.
 But download at your own risk, friend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048336103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1502553253}
review:
A bit more heavy-handed and rough around the edges compared to the original, with the difficulty level jumping wilder than a neurotic cougar on a pogo stick, but still quite enjoyable.

To those who haven't played Majesty 1, think of it as a game where you take on the role of a game master of some generic fantasy MMORPG.
You build potion shops, smithies and inns, create quests, and pay great rewards for their completion. Then you sit back, relax, and watch your adventurers fight monsters, level up and discover treasures of great value, just to waste every hard-earned gold coin away on all those expensive trinkets that your shops are selling for Most Reasonable Prices(tm).
Little do the poor sods realise they are nothing but disposable tools of your personal agenda...

author: {'steamid': '76561198124480483', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1558960583}
review: Очень давно, прохождил эту игру на пиратке. Прошёл все дополнения. Игра несомненно крутая. И вот, я в мечтах о нормальном мультеплеере покупаю эту игру по скидке за 300 рублей и... И нихера, ибо сервера всеми любимого "ГеймСпай" закрыты и мультиплеер более не работает. Скажите что можно играть вместе по локальной сети(или через хамачи) , но увы, я не нашёл никого с кем можно поиграть, поэтому это очень обидно. Проблем с ДЛС я не получил, все дополнения работают нормально без танцев с бубном. Огромный минус - это озвучка. Почему её нету? Ведь есть официальная очень хорошая озвучка. Качать с других сайтов не очень то и хочется, а английская версия... Ну уже не то. Голос того же советника в английской версии - не родной чтоли. Я рекомендую эту игру, но если хотите полностью ощутить шарм - установите или русскую озвучку , или тупо скачайте пиратку. Скачав пиратку вы всё равно ничего не потеряете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056587024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1537112181}
review:
If you've played Majesty, then this game and its mechanics won't be foriegn to you. If you haven't, then the game may feel strange and difficult to understand. The premise is that you, the "King" do not directly control the Heroes in the game. Each camp that you build (Rangers, Warriors, Thieves, Wizards, Clerics along with Dwarves and Elves in certain scenerios) allows you to recruit 3 of that class. Upgrading the camp gives you certain bonus abilities to the class, and some directly to you. Since you don't control the Heroes directly, you have to use Rewards (in Gold) to influence where the Heroes explore, avoid, or with bounties, kill something. That's the basic gist of what made Majesty so fun, and what should make this sequel fun as well.

HOWEVER...

This game is ridiculously hard. Not impossibly hard, but there are times when you have to slow down, take a break, and seek a different solution to some enemies. As you build up your settlement with camps, the peasants will build houses, and with that comes the sewers, which place vermin (rats, ratmen, and such) directly into your town. Guard towers help, by allowing a Guardsman to patrol and hopefully attack said vermin, but you'll need to place the towers in overlapping COI (Circles of Influence) to have a really good patrol of guards. The guard towers increase in price as you build them, so it does get costly early on. Once a Hero dies, you then spawn a graveyard in town, which spawns undead, so that's yet another threat to try and maintain control of, as it can rapidly escalate and detroy your camps and castle if you aren't careful.

 The biggest problem with this game is the (as yet, unsolved on steam) broken Internet detection for the DLCs. Majesty had a really simple story, but Majesty 2 seems to have went for a more episodic mission line, and left connections to previous missions out. It seems that there isn't any connection to the DLCs as such, so you'll be playing the game for the gameplay, not the story. It doesn't really subtract from the game, though, since there isn't really any "lore" for the game anyway.

As of this review, I haven't played any of the expansions yet. The main game is entertaining and fun, and appeals to my love of solving puzzles, each mission having multiple ways of doing so. I highly recommend this game, but with the expansion issue in mind, I'd wait for a steam sale or discounts to purchase it, until steam fixes the DLC issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970196782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1492197265}
review:
The mission designs for this game are mind bogglingly aweful. After the initial maps (which are enjoyable), you are placed into scenarios where you will have multiple enemy spawn points within view of your keep and they WILL spawn monsters before you get your first building completed. You will attempt to get buildings erected but your pesants will get killed (slowing or stopping construction), or the buildings will be attacked (slowing down or destroying your construction and wasting your gold), your tax collectors will get killed as they make their rounds (delaying or halting your income), and your heroes will constantly get mobbed (forcing them to hide in the guild hall for healing and be ineffective, or they'll die), dead heroes cause a graveyard to spawn nearby (which also spawns more monsters), etc...

Administrative style games (where you do not have direct control of your units) requre a build up phase to allow a player to prepare for threats. Especially because a player is unable to directly send the heroes to address threats at a moments notice. Using the flags and bounty system to incentivize your heroes takes money from your coffers and only works if you make the bounty large enough to grab their attention. Setting bounties, of course, hinders your ability to build essential infrastructure. 


The issues that this game has is not a matter of lack of player skill. There is very poor balancing in the game's economy and combat systems. There are some well concieved scenarios in the first third of the game where you are under constant pressure and the challenge is intense and enjoyable. However, in other scenarios where the waves of enemies constantly intensify, your base's capabilities will palteau and eventually crumble, but the enemy will not plateau. When this is combined with a scenario that causes you to constantly struggle to build and keep two or three buildings standing, you end up with a frustrating and disappointing experience.

Unfortunately, it takes more than two hours to find this out, so a refund is off the table. My time with Magesty 2 makes me wonder if the devs actually had the game playtested it to understand exactly what kind of play experience they were actually creating. The genere is one of my favorites, the gameplay can be at times enjoyable, but there is too much in this game that is not enjoyable. 

I recommend not buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012712922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327, 'last_played': 1492283612}
review:
I recommend this game with a but.

I love the concept and most of the execution.  The visuals are pleasing given the time of release.  The themes are enjoyable.  The interface is intuitive.  I also like the humor tucked into this game.  It's mostly dark humor to be sure, and goes somewhere along the lines of "Who just died?  Oh so-and-so (generally a Rogue or a Ranger, sometimes a Wizard or Warrior), why am I not surprised?  What is that, like, the fourth time I've resurrected you this week?  When are you going to learn not to run into that pack of Elementals?" or when you see a Cleric cast Divine Hammer on an enemy for the first time and watch them get flung basically across your town (even more humorous for me they landed right in the midst of a group of warriors who were more than happy to take the XP and gold for the kill).  Dirtiest trick in the game I've found so far is build two Cleric Guilds off the start and heal your enemies to death through the amount of sustain you can bring to a fight.

As for the "but", the largest issue I have is this game has no sense of scale.  Pretty much every mission is survive the attrition of the early game, and once you've survived till mid game the levels are basically unloseable.  If the game was better balanced to have some form of mild scaling it would make the early game more enjoyable/less punishing while still giving something of a challenge late game.  RNG is another problem with this game.  Some levels you get a Werewolf or some such spawn super early and it one shots its way through your base.  Most levels rarely last till the late game either.  Either some boss you need to fight randomly runs into your town, or one of your explorers procs said boss, or the level is designed with a timed trigger.  This means you rarely get to just sit back and enjoy the immensity of potential this game has to offer in the late game once you've levelled everything, have properly organized your parties, and are ready to fight everything on the map.  Instead most levels end prematurely in a frantic cluster shart as you try and keep your mob of heroes alive while they battle the Big Bad.  Most times it's anticlimactic cause you had more things you wanted to do before the final show down and instead your plans fizzle to "Well I guess it's just time to win then".

So far my favorite levels are Lich King and the Vampire Lords because their starts are not too ridiculous (for Lich King just randomly generating undead portals that are easy for early heroes to deal with and offers them nice XP and for Vampire Lords just a constant stream of Serpents and Undead for heroes to easily level off of), they offer you the ability to do everything you want to (in the case of Vampire Lords even building four temples), it allows you to decide when to fight the last battle because the Big Bads stay in areas that are easy to keep foolish explorers from procing the end fight, AND that last battle is still somewhat punishing even to late game heroes (More so in Lich King, in Vampire Lords my parties were so strong and the Big Bad got so chain cc'ed that it was a foregone conclusion from the start).

Despite these issues I picked the game up for $2 on a weekend sale because I originally bought this game back when CDs were a thing and remember enjoying it immensely, and I still do.  There's nothing more satisfying than watching the heroes you've raised from newbs work as an army of parties to steam roll some hapless Big Bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092477150', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1491633174}
review:
Changing my review based on fan made  paradox "approved" patch  -

The multiplayer servers are down, this was a big issue previously because the DLC and bonus content were connected to the servers causing even single player to severely suffer.  It sucks that a fan had to "fix" this rather then an official update to the game but the single player seems to work if you take the steps to manually fix with the patch.

The game itself lacks some of the charm of the original Majesty, and it isn't well balanced. However it is one of the very few of these types of "no direct control" RTS games in a niche genre. I like the original better but when you've played it to death Majesty 2 is fun. It is a pretty good game and succeeds at what it attempts for the most part. 

If you enjoy high fantasy and games where you don't directly control your units It's worth picking up on sale. Just make sure to get the patch on the Paradox forums.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029531436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 81795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1702100137}
review:
Edit:
So, Steam asked me to edit my review, since I kept playing the game (a lot). First of all, the excruciatingly slow building speed, which made the game unplayable for me, is actually a bug. Apparently building time is linked to in-game fps (Which mustn't go above 60fps). You need to turn on v-sync (either in-game options or forced by graphic card controls).
I still find it very frustrating, that you get no warning about this. It's not like anyone could guess a bug like that!

Some of the missions are still somewhat frustrating and luck-dependent. But that's mostly the first campaign. The other 3 are much better in this regard.

Original review:
Mission design is completely broken.
Watched a few youtube videos of this game and thought it looked fun. But in the actual game buildings take longer to complete than the first enemy wave to arrive. (Seems to be a different version than most youtube videos?)`

This way actually finishing your first prodcution building (and surviving the first wave) before all your workers are killed is pure luck.
That's no fun AT ALL.

review: Been reading reviews with some people having difficulty playing and the game not starting/working at all. Bought the game anyway and it works. gameplay is nice since I played the very old version of this one years ago. Many people complain on game difficulty, but all you really need to do is think of a strategy from the start to beat a level. If you fail at first then replay the mission and think of what building to place and start to level your heroes until they can defend attacking monsters to your kingdom. Don't rush placing all buildings as it will spawn more waves of enemies and placing towers and upgrading is a must :) Players with little to no patience don't buy this.

Sometimes I wonder if these developers even play test there own game for balance...
Well after several maps it becomes repetitive and fustratiing to enjoy...I really wanted to like this game but screenshots are better than the game play.... Many Youtube videos show the first few hours of game play and thats were most of the fun was before it became a choir...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005213655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1503786137}
review:
Docela povedený remake jedné výborné klasiky. 

Na začátek stručně pro ty, kteří hráli už jedničku. Hra je více méně to samé, co byl první díl. Změny v zásadách hry jsou více méně kosmetické, hra je možná jen malinko náročnější. Kdo si chce oprášit vzpomínky v modernějším hávu rozhodně nebude zklamaný. Kdo čeká nějaký posun a nové nápady a nebo nějaké grafické orgie, ten asi zklamaný bude. 

A teď pro nové hráče. Dá se říci, že Majesty je jedinečnou strategickou hrou s RPG nádechem. Ocitnete se v roli krále, jehož panství neustále pronásledují nějaké problémy. A protože panovník má vládnout a ne někde pobíhat s mečem, musíte si sehnat lidi, kteří za vás problémy vyřeší. Takže začnete najímat různé hrdiny, které pak jedinou smysluplnou motivací, čili penězi, vysíláte plnit nějaké úkoly. Tedy vysíláte. Určíte odměnu za úkol a budete doufat, že si bohatýr řekne, že je dostatečně vysoká, aby zvedl zadek a vámi určené zadání vykonal... Hrdinu můžete najmout v speciální guildě, kterou před tím musíte vystavět. Také máte k dispozici několik ekonomických budov, které vám budou generovat peníze a hrdinům umožňovat nákup lepšího vybavení a také pár obranných struktur. Ale nemusíte se děsit, žádné složité budovatelské úkoly vás nečekají. Stavět budete stále podobným stylem, jen si na některých mapách budete muset rozmyslet pořadí stavěných budov.

Pokud jde o grafiku, tak plní svůj účel, ale možná to chtělo v době vydání už přeci jen něco víc. Na druhou stranu neuráží a velmi rychle si člověk na ni zvykne. Hudba a zvuky pasují k tématu, neruší, spíše příjemně doplňují. Ovládání je jednoduché a intuitivní. Velmi rychle se ho člověk naučí. Náročnost misí docela rychle stoupá, po odehrání tutorialu a  se nováček může u druhéhého třetího normálního levelu trochu zapotit. Steam verze hry má problémy se připojit na obchod (návody na internetu, jak to vyřešit jsou staré a už neplatí - tedy alespoň v momentě psaní recenze), ale k hraní to není vůbec nutné. Je to irituje při každém startu, kdy hra hlásí, že se nemůže připojit a člověk si říká, že zrovna tuhle věc by profesionálové mohli vyřešit - a nebo vypnout, když je stejně k ničemu. 

A pro koho je hra určená? Vychutnají si ji asi milovníci fantasy a lidé, kteří si sem a tam zahrají nějakou nenáročnou strategii nebo RPG. Čas při ní krásně utíká, možná se jen po několikáté misi objeví u někoho určitá únava z monotematičnosti. Kovaný stratég milující hodiny přemýšlet o jednom tahu si ale tady asi moc neužije, stejně tak hra není určená pro skalní fanoušky klikacích masakrů stylu Diabla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019597917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1603804979}
review: Unique gameplay style however it will get repetitive. It is also very hard as in impossible or unfair as there is no difficulty. I do appreciate difficult games however replaying the same level not finding the solution is a bit annoying. My biggest praise is in the requirement for units to level up and gain abilities as the game progresses. However for the campaign you are limited to three heroes you can take per level so it kind of falls short on progressing into creating a formidable force. Its major downfall is its repetitiveness. While watching the heroes run around doing their jobs and level is fun, it is the same build and gameplay strategy for most of the levels. It was fun for the first couple of days but watching your units grind away is a bit boring after a while. I would only recommend if you are a fan of the game or are looking for a different gameplay style.

review:
I discovered this game by accident a while ago and am so glad I did.

It is a novel concept, in that you don't directly control the heroes, but you can influence them to do what you want by setting quests for them and building shops so they can better equip. This alone is a great part of the game. Throw in the wit, the decent learning curve, and the simplicity of the game mechanics and you've got a game I go back to again and again.

review:
[u]WARNING DO NOT BUY! WARNING DO NOT BUY! WARNING DO NOT BUY![/u]
________________________________________________

Bought this game yesterday and as many many others I got the error of no internet connection when starting the game (also means no Singleplayer).
There is a fishy fix suggested by a Dev where you should register at their forums and verify with your game key to see the details but it's not possible because the forum doesn't send you an email-confirmation link to activate your account. (See pinned discussion in steam forums.)

[b]That this game is still being sold is basically a scam and I already requested a refund![/b]

[i]P.S.: As far as i have overlooked from crawling the forum threads the game doesn't work because it was made for GameSpy (which doesn't exist anymore) and Devs somehow weren't able to provide a fix through direct steam patching.
There are no more paid Devs working on this and it seems like the fix was done by a dude on his last day of work while being drunk.
No one cares any more and even people who first bought the game are now pirating because the cracked versions actually do work, lol. [/i]

review: Игра прекрасна, но в ней не работает мультиплеер, а русский язык устанавливается путем почти полной замены файлов с пиратской копии и банального кряка. Бонусов от использования лицухи практически нет. Если вы думаете поддержать разрабов, то подумайте - стоит ли поддерживать тех ,кто вообще не думает о комьюнити(особенно с учетом того ,что творилось в игре при вводе второго ДЛС  с магазином, которое и убила мульиплеер). Итог - поиграть точно стоит, ибо без вас игра проживет, а вот вы лишитесь того волшебства, которой она окружена . Но вот брать в стиме - тут еще стоит подумать.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983507848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1460669585}
review:
Старый добрый симулятор средневекового фэнтезийного королевства.
Все у вас есть - горсть денег на первое время, хижина с крестьянином, стражник и сборщик налогов.
Строим гильдии и нанимаем воинов, паладинов, лучников, магов и прочих замечательных ребят за кровью и потом отобранные у крестьян монеты. Но вся эта воинствующая братия невероятно самовольна и даже не думает соблюдать субординацию, поэтому никому из них нельзя отдать приказы по защите ваших фамильных земель или по завоеванию будущих фамильных земель. Вместо этого можно лишь пообещать награду за какие-то достижения вроде убийства монстра или защиты рынка от троллей, и если награда велика, а все герои не веселяться в ближайшем трактире, то может быть кто-нибудь из них соизволит выполнить вашу просьбу, в ходе которой он скорее всего умрет. После смерти героя придется опять ободрать местное население, чтобы нанять замену павшему [strike] лентяю [/strike], [strike] алчному мошеннику [/strike] ГЕРОЮ, чтобы тот снова повторил цикл.
